Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This opulent wine offers amazingly concentrated, ripe fruit flavors and a creamy texture. Layers of black cherry, blueberry and raspberry syrup are followed by rosemary and pine. Made from 80% whole clusters and 20% aged in new oak, it is an indulgent and delicious wine that beautifully supports its fruity extravagance with a slightly tangy and subtly tannic texture. Best from 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Drew 2018 Estate Field Selections Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine starts with aromas of pine needle and tarragon, with joyous bowlfuls of ripe yet snappy raspberry and cherry chiming in. Herbal elegance shines throughout the sip, giving eucalyptus-like depth to the juicy red-fruit flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Melville 2019 Sandy's Block Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Rose petal and mint accents merge with deep, concentrated black-fruit flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine that is laced with velvety, fine-grained tannins. It combines superb balance with layers of fruit and subtle spices for a very compelling palate. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Drew 2019 The Fog-Eater Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Fort Ross-Seaview, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a site overlooking the Pacific Ocean and Gualala River, planted at the urging of Warren Dutton, this wine is outstanding. Peppery, floral and fruity on the nose and palate, it evolves in the glass to show elegant acidity and earthy, herbal qualities, with tones of crushed rock, sea air and black tea.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2018 McDougall Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump and ripe cherries and berries pop on the nose of this block designate, as do damp tea leaves and dewy sagebrush aromas. The palate is perky with crisp and pure red-cherry flavors that appeal to the hedonistic side, while the pine needle and minty tarragon tones inspire intellectual enjoyment.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Melville 2019 Anna's Block Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the producer's own home estate planted in 2009, this is a gorgeous reckoning of minty sage, black tea and cool-climate hits of pomegranate and rhubarb. The tannins are strong and supportive and soften in the glass, showing graceful structure that complements the crisp, persistent acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Small Vines 2018 TBH Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark cherry, sweet sage, light cardamom cream and a steely minerality are expertly integrated on the nose of this bottling from an iconic vineyard. It's a hearty wine on the palate, loaded with both roasted cherry and taut raspberry, but it's the array of chaparral herbs, from wild thyme to juniper and bay leaf, that provide the most intrigue.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kosta Browne 2018 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this exciting bottling offers pronounced aromas of thyme, juniper and green peppercorn, with just the right amount of crisp red fruit. The taut and fresh flavors of cranberry and pomegranate are wrapped in tea leaves and pine needles on the engaging palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Madson 2019 Ascona Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Pfalz, Germany
Description: More floral and transparent in fruit than the producer's more robust, earthier Kammerberg, the Sankt Paul offers bristling raspberry and red-plum flavors accented by hints of leather and forest floor. Sourced from a limestone outcrop on the Alsatian border, it's a fresh, invigorating red that drinks well now but should continue to improve through 2035.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich Becker 2015 Sankt Paul Pinot Noir (Pfalz)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From two vineyard sites just a few miles from the Pacific Ocean, this wine is juicy in cranberry and pomegranate. Lifted accents of white pepper, orange peel and rose add complexity and nuance to the robust frame.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford Court 2018 Land's Edge Vineyards Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Pfalz, Germany
Description: It only takes a whiff to appreciate the intense ripeness and power of black cherries and plums in this deeply concentrated, complex red. Sourced from 50-year-old vines planted on lime-marl soils on the Alsatian border, it's a rich but vibrantly balanced, profoundly earthen Pinot Noir framed in fine, gripping tannins. Tasted in January 2021, it's still an electric, youthful wine that will only improve through 2035.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich Becker 2015 Kammerberg Pinot Noir (Pfalz)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Brick-black-raspberry-jam aromas are cut by pine needle, damp herbs and wet cement on the nose of this bottling. The palate packs fresh cranberry with seared orange-rind flavors, as hints of sage and pine linger into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Melville 2019 Block M Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Brick-black-raspberry-jam aromas are cut by pine needle, damp herbs and wet cement on the nose of this bottling. The palate packs fresh cranberry with seared orange-rind flavors, as hints of sage and pine linger into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Melville 2019 Block M Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Boldly flavorful and structured, this estate wine was fermented with 25% whole-cluster grapes, adding texture and supple depth to an already elegant frame. Succulent in tangy currant, cherry and raspberry, it hints at forest, black tea and turned earth beneath. Time further aging should be rewarded; enjoy best from 2028 through 2033.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hanzell 2018 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From an east-facing ridge above Occidental, this perfumed wine opens in fresh notes of herb de Provence—a feral, seductive statement of what's to come. Structured, complex and ageworthy, this tiny-production offering continues in cranberry, compost and black tea, the bright acidity laced throughout.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Small Vines 2018 MK Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This bold but light-bodied wine wraps phenomenal fruitiness and freshness in lively acidity and fine-grained tannins for a rare mix of vibrancy and concentration. It stops short of full ripeness and lures with red cherry, sour cherry and rhubarb flavors that are intense and long. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Drew 2019 Faîte de Mer Farm Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This tempting, trim wine is alive with red-cherry, rhubarb and raspberry flavors that hold back a bit on ripeness but offer a palate-tingling vibrancy and great balance. Because of its tempting restraint yet good focus and linger finish, it keeps calling for another sip. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Drew 2019 Valenti Ranch Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With savory fruit and an edgy structure, this wine intrigues and beguiles, offering rose petal, wet stone, blueberry and black cherry alongside firm, well-integrated tannins. Balanced and bright, it evolves to show shades of black tea and forest floor that keep it complex.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2018 Emerald Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Among a superb lineup from Harper Voit, this takes the blue ribbon. Scents of Bourbon barrel, vanilla and tea entice, then thread through flavors of pomegranate and red berries. It's wound up tight, with compact power that suggests a long life ahead. The balance, complexity and finishing details are exceptional.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2018 Bramble Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This site was planted in 2001 on a ridge above the Laguna de Santa Rosa in Sebastopol. Deep, dark fruit takes on a surprising richness around subdued acidity and sumptuous, seductive tones of tea and baking spice. With impressive breadth it is complex and complicated, with tension and grace in equal measure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Small Vines 2018 Baranoff Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Enticing aromas of graphite, forest floor, menthol and tobacco mingle with whiffs of rhubarb pie in this Pinot Nero. Vibrant and focused, the savory palate delivers juicy red cherry, raspberry, star anise and white pepper before a salty, mineral finish. Bright acidity and taut, refined tannins provide support and balance. Drink 2022–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Pancrazi 2016 Villa di Bagnolo Pinot Nero (Toscana)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This blends several single-vineyard estate sites including Baranoff and TBH together. It shows a mastery of nuance and elegance, with a funky opening of dried herb and forest needle. Dense tannins provide a foundation of structure and weight that settle in the glass and show immense potential for aging, the acidity pronounced and poised.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Small Vines 2018 Estate Cuvée Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Gevrey-Chambertin, Burgundy, France
Description: Old vines between 80 and 100 years in age have produced a concentrated, structured wine. Smoky and delicious already, it has a considerable future as well. Tannins, spice from wood aging and black fruits have come together to give a wine that should be ready from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gérard Seguin 2019 Vieilles Vignes  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep aromas of candied black raspberry, lavender and violet are dark but lively on the nose of this blend of three vineyards from across the coastal side of the appellation. Crisp red fruit hits the palate with energy, then delivers warmer hints of charcuterie in layers of flavor.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Soquel Vineyards 2019 Unexplored Territory Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep aromas of candied black raspberry, lavender and violet are dark but lively on the nose of this blend of three vineyards from across the coastal side of the appellation. Crisp red fruit hits the palate with energy, then delivers warmer hints of charcuterie in layers of flavor.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Soquel Vineyards 2019 Unexplored Territory Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This clonal showcase offers strong aromas of incense, bay leaf, iron shavings, mushroom and elderberry. These tones lead into a palate that's hefty in dry tannins, but they uphold the roasted berry, black-plum, iodine and forest-floor flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2018 Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Marlborough, New Zealand
Description: This Pinot blends fruit from three vineyards including TWR's home block of old, biodynamically farmed vines, and Clayvin, Giesen winery's prized single vineyard. Anna and Jason Flowerday's Pinot is vastly different than Giesen's however. It's more muscular, dark fruited and tautly wound, weaving plump plum and cherry fruit with savory and baking spice, bay leaf, clove and a lick of oatmeal-like oak. Tannins are powerful yet fine and chiseled. Should cellar beautifully until 2030 at least.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Te Whare Ra 2017 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Scented with toasted hazelnuts, and sporting flavors of rhubarb-strawberry pie, this delicious wine just keeps on giving, even as it trails away. As with several of the winery's 2018s, it comes with a whiff of funk, here a light and pleasant accent. The overall balance and length punch up the score. About 30% of the barrels were new.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Fullerton 2018 Bella Vida Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: McMinnville, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This fine-tuned elaboration emphasizes the fruit component of this biodynamic vineyard with crisp, fresh raspberry flavors upfront. The wet rock minerality of the AVA and the inherent herbal pungency of the site are threaded in, and the finish is buoyed with juicy acidity that brightens it. Slightly more than one-quarter of the barrels were new.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Fullerton 2018 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The blend once again is Pommard and Calera clones. This is a supple, layered wine, which impresses immediately with its aromatic complexity. Raspberry, orange marmalade, a streak of caramel and polished tannins evoking green tea are beautifully integrated. The flavors continue unimpeded through a long and nicely detailed finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2017 Bieze Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Pure, focused and vibrant fruit flavors at the core of this elegant, superbly balanced wine give it a rare vibrancy and power. Delicious, tangy red and black cherry mingle with light cinnamon and ginger accents on a nicely firm palate of fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Best from 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Drew 2019 Mid-Elevation Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Having spent nine months in new French oak, this wine offers a mix of bright acidity and crunchy red fruit. It uncovers white pepper, lavender and forest floor accents as it develops, yielding a wine that shows tremendous value for the quality.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hanzell 2019 Sebella Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the far reaches of Annapolis, this coastal site contributes enviable elegance and delicacy to a core of enduring freshness and crisp red fruit. Light on its feet, it offers pomegranate, cranberry and a twist of orange peel, finishing in tea and firm, supple tannin.                      Virginie Boone
Name: AldenAlli 2017 Campbell Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump and juicy aromas of mulberry, violet, lilac and lavender make for an elegant entry to the nose of this bottling. The deeply layered elegance expands to the palate, where berry, plum and pomegranate flavors are decorated by nutmeg and mace.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Loring Wine Company 2019 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made predominantly from grapes grown at the Fog Dance Vineyard, a vineyard-designate of its own, this memorably delicious wine is light in color and delicately inviting in tangerine, peach and strawberry. Stainless-steel fermented, it remains crisp on the palate with just a touch of orangesicle richness on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford Court 2020 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this blend of nine clones from three vineyards touches both juicy fruit and minty earth, as aromas range from warm cherry, vanilla and crème brûlée to forest herb. The sip shows generous waves of cherry, raspberry and pomegranate, riding a taut midpalate into the forest-floor elements of the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Soquel Vineyards 2019 Stretched Boundaries Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made predominantly from grapes grown at the Fog Dance Vineyard, a vineyard-designate of its own, this memorably delicious wine is light in color and delicately inviting in tangerine, peach and strawberry. Stainless-steel fermented, it remains crisp on the palate with just a touch of orangesicle richness on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford Court 2020 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Opulent aromas of creamy baked blackberry and boysenberry pie meet with strawberry rhubarb and sea-salt caramel on the rich nose of this bottling. Warm and heavy spices of star anise and clove decorate the palate, where flavors of plum pudding and blackberry compote make for a powerful sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Loring Wine Company 2019 Cortada Alta Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This svelte, elegant wine delivers the finesse that only the best Pinots possess. Cranberry-raspberry fruit flavors are light and fresh, gently accented with just-picked garden herbs. The overall elegance, depth and balance suggest a long life ahead. Drink 2023–2033.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2017 Antiquum Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From this tiny site atop Ribbon Ridge come some of the winery's finest Pinots. Lush aromas with a pinpoint focus on dusty raspberry fruit are highlighted with accents of powdered coffee. The AVA's uplifted sedimentary soils add a hint of seashell also. It's a splendid wine, as is the 2018 edition.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2017 Bramble Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Firm and tart, this punches through with pretty raspberry and cherry fruit, set upon a substantial tannic base. The balance is spot-on, and the lengthy finish proposes cellaring awhile longer before pulling the cork. Drink 2024–2035.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2017 Terrarossa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This vineyard always shows classic cool-climate elements and edge, the acidity intensely crisp and focused around sharp red-fruit tones of pomegranate and rhubarb. With well-integrated tannin and oak, it reveals secondary notes of black tea, forest and citrus peel before a peppery spicy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Reeve 2018 Rice-Spivak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is made primarily from grapes grown on the coastal Baranoff Vineyard, planted in Goldridge soils with several clones in the mix. Sleek, sharp red fruit adorns a grippy midpalate of elegant power that finds its way to bright underlying acidity and a complexity of mineral and savory undertones.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Small Vines 2018 Estate Cuvée Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Chalone, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Charred boysenberry, wild strawberry, chai spice and wet, gravelly soil aromas come through on the layered nose of this bottling. Oak spice sinks into the palate, framing the roasted raspberry and cardamom flavors, set atop a pleasantly rocky texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fulcrum 2019 Brosseau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This new brand from Zaca Mesa focuses on Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, and this countywide Pinot blend is a stunner. Aromas of rainy slate, pomegranate and hibiscus roll into a palate of sumac, red fruit and light game that sizzles with acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tread 2019 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The epitome of zestiness in a red wine, this lightly colored bottling begins with tart cranberry, orange zest, peppercorn and a hint of eucalyptus oil on the nose. Sichuan pepper and green-peppercorn flavors spice up the palate, where pomegranate and fresh acidity would pair well even with delicate fish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Scar of the Sea 2019 Bassi Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From high atop the Petaluma Gap at 1,000-feet-elevation, this powerfully structured wine shows a density of tannin and ripe berry fruit. The grip gives in to a seductive midpalate of cardamom, black tea and crushed rock, showing texture and nuance amidst the concentration and spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: AldenAlli 2017 Sunchase Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-plum and cherry-cordial aromas are lifted by star anise and a savory touch of game on the nose of this bottling. It lands with a rich mouthfeel on the palate, delivering earthy flavors of sage and thyme as well as baked wild strawberry fruit and spicy star anise and vanilla elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kynsi 2018 Precious Stone Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Gevrey-Chambertin, Burgundy, France
Description: This small vineyard, just on the edge of the village of Gevrey-Chambertin, has produced a rich wine, still with obvious wood aging flavors that will integrate over the next years. The black fruits and structure promise aging, giving a wine that is dense and full. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gérard Seguin 2019 Craipillot Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite jubilant on the nose, this single-vineyard expression pops with tangy cherry and raspberry-jam aromas, as fennel pollen and star anise add spice tones. That spice rack explodes on the palate, where cardamom and anise integrate into wild strawberry and plum flavors, with lavender and hibiscus lift on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Loring Wine Company 2019 Peake Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Ben Lomond Mountain, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and perfectly ripe aromas of strawberry and black raspberry meet with forest notes of juniper and bay plus a rusty minerality on the nose of this bottling. Grippy tannins frame the layered sip, where pomegranate and dark-plum flavors are woven through lavender, tea-leaf, cardamom and even coriander elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Soquel Vineyards 2019 Coast Grade Vineyard Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Ben Lomond Mountain)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a vineyard in Annapolis, this is profoundly cool-climate in its grasp of dried herb and mineral components. Pomegranate, rhubarb and raspberry combine around a complex structure of lightweight yet firm tannins. Drink 2024–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2018 Redwood Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Baden, Germany
Description: Fresh fruited and slim in profile, this zesty Pinot Noir balances crisp black-cherry and dried strawberry flavors against a zippy spine of acidity. Edged with crushed stone and a lingering smoky undertone, it's a juicy but complex and nuanced wine at peak now through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Franz Keller 2018 vom Löss Pinot Noir (Baden)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded and elegant aromas of cherry cream, light cola, berry crumble and subtle charcuterie float across the nose on this single-vineyard expression. The dried cherry and cranberry flavors of the palate are enhanced by rooibos tea, dried herbs and baked earth flavors, making for a very complex sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dierberg 2017 Dierberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Wonderfully ripe and vibrant fruit flavors and great balance give this well-polished wine a sophisticated appeal. Well-focused black cherry and tart cherry mingle with light baking spices, a touch of toasted oak and moderate tannins in this exciting wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Black Kite 2018 Redwoods Egde Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is one of those appellation blends where the sum is greater than its already excellent parts. Rich and lush aromas of black cherry, boysenberry, cardamom and vanilla slide into an opulent palate of baked berry pie, its warm vanilla crust spiced by white pepper.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Loring Wine Company 2019 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Marlborough, New Zealand
Description: This is a bright and bouncy springtime Pinot from the well regarded organic producer Fromm. The cinnamon and clove spice get along graciously with the slinky red and blueberry fruit and floral characters. Tingly acidity on the palate makes the fruit pop. It's backed by savory, sappy notes and a talc-like cinch of tannins that hits just at the right spot. Light-bodied and chillable, this is a playful yet seriously well made wine. Drink now–2027.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Fromm Winery 2018 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is old vine Pommard fruit sourced from the Fir Crest Vineyard. Lush cherry fruit is accented with subtle layers and details of dried herbs, including a hint of mint. Aging in one-third new French oak barrels adds toasted coconut and a wash of milk chocolate to the lingering finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Fullerton 2018 Brutus Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Aromas push a pleasantly funky note front and center. Stiff cherry fruit touches on dried fruit leather in flavor. Barrel aging brings in sandalwood and toasted cashews. The wine finishes with a burst of butter brickle. Enjoy this now and over the next half decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Fullerton 2018 Croft Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The ferment included 40% whole clusters and was finished in just 13% new French oak. Pretty flavors of blackberry jam push the fruit into the foreground, with a lovely impression of almond paste filling out the finish. The fade resonates with a hint of sea breeze and seashells, characteristic of this AVA.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Fullerton 2018 Lichtenwalter Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Classic Dundee Hills fruit is on display here—cherries, cherries and more cherries. There's a dusting of baking spices and lovely barrel flavors as well, a tasty mix of cinnamon, cocoa and caramel. The finish is smooth and delicious all the way through.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2018 Terrarossa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Ahr, Germany
Description: Delicate hints of burnt caramel and leather work to accent crisp, cutting notes of sour cherry and fresh strawberry in this briskly composed Pinot Noir. While full bodied and silky in texture, it maintains a transparency of fruit and pert acidic structure that's invigorating. Approachable young, it should continue to improve through at least 2030 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Meyer-Näkel 2018 Blue Slate Pinot Noir (Ahr)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Savory and edgy, this cool-climate style wine is deliciously balanced, bright and brooding in blackberry, pomegranate and rhubarb. The crisp fruit is seasoned in a mix of baking spice, cardamom and a hint of white pepper, the tannins well-tamed.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Red Car 2018 Heaven & Earth Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely fresh and fruity on the nose, this bottling is loaded with deliciously ripe strawberry, pomegranate and cherry aromas, as well as a hint of brown spice. The palate's strawberry core is cut by lemon and orange rind, with potpourri spices that extend on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tread 2019 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a compelling combination of freshness and density to the nose of this single-vineyard bottling, showing baked but still tart black raspberry and warm, spicy pie crust aromas. The mouthfeel is quite full and loaded with those same elements, proving smooth in texture and lifted by thyme and wild sage.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Loring Wine Company 2019 Kessler-Haak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This young wine brushes lightly against a not-unpleasant funky note. Scents of peat moss drift into the flavor palate, along with spicy cranberry, blueberry and a finishing lick of a cinnamon latte.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2018 Antiquum Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a dark, youthful, spicy wine packed densely with black fruits. Blackberries, black cherries and black currants are all in play, with a frame of lightly toasty, textured tannins. The impeccable balance rests upon pinpoint acidity, and with its muscular structure and overall density this is a candidate for a decade of aging. Drink through 2030.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Walter Scott 2019 Cuvée Ruth Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made in small quantities by the winemaking team at Nottingham Cellars, this is a new project focused on Pinots with a sense of place. It succeeds in sumptuous layers of cherry and strawberry dipped in baking spice and cardamom, with trace layers of black tea, citrus and a touch of caramel.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Typicité 2019 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Gevrey-Chambertin, Burgundy, France
Description: Produced from 70-year-old vines, this wine is well structured, dense with ageworthy tannins. Wood aging has underlined the structure while also broadening the black-cherry fruits. This balanced wine will be ready from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gérard Seguin 2019 Les Crais  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp pomegranate and tart strawberry scents zing across light game and wet earth aromas on the nose of this bottling. It's very brisk and lively on the sip, with tart boysenberry and plum flavors, framed by chalky, tight tannins that will unfold for years. Drink now through 2033.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Madson 2018 Les Enfants des Nuages Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This tangy, nervy, slightly restrained wine offers an appetizing tension between not-quite fully ripe red cherry and rhubarb flavors and good, balancing acidity. Hints of cinnamon, rosemary and forest floor give it plenty to savor. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Black Kite 2018 Stony Terrace Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap-Marin County, North Coast, California, US
Description: Earth, smoke and toasted walnut aromas, subdued fruit flavors and lots of mushroom and game notes come together in this full-bodied wine for an unusually savory expression of the grape. It's an interesting, complex wine that takes a tasty detour away from the usual fruit-centered pours.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Brooks Note 2018 Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap-Marin County)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light in the glass, this bottling offers herbal and fresh aromas of pine needle as well as iron and sour cherry on the nose. The herbal tones prove even more delicious on the high-acid palate, where juniper and moss add depth to a snappy and fresh raspberry flavor.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Scott Family 2018 Dijon Clone Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rose petal, crushed rock and baked cherry accent this structured, complex wine that is tremendously balanced and full of elegant depth. Fleshy, lush and creamy on the midpalate, it evolves to show a hint of cola, black tea and black pepper, forest notes never far behind.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford Court 2018 Jennifer's Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Marlborough, New Zealand
Description: From the most prized vineyard of this large Marlborough estate, this is a solid, likable example of Pinot from this famed region. The nose is a sweet-savory combo of plump red berries, violets and peppery, earthy spice, with more umami-like notes of hoisin sauce and mushrooms. The mouthfeel is soft yet structured, the teeter totter of fruit and savory interrupted by fresh acidity and silky fine tannins, with a savory tinge to the finish. Drink now–2029.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Giesen 2016 Clayvin Single Vineyard Selection Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Softly stewed raspberry and poached plum aromas meet with hibiscus and rose potpourri on the nose of this new single-vineyard pick-up for this iconic brand. Tart red-plum and strawberry tones engage the palate, where a snappy acidity carries a lingering hint of fennel pollen into the texturally taut finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kosta Browne 2018 Mt. Carmel Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark red currants, pomegranate and raspberry aromas meet with a tarry earth minerality as well as tarragon and mint on the very layered nose of this bottling. There's a gamy streak on the palate that pairs well with raspberry-jam and raspberry-compote flavors, with orange rind, flowering herbs and muddled spice on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Biddle Ranch 2018 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fairly dark in the glass, this bottling from a historic vineyard offers the telltale hints of wet earth and light game as well as dark-fruit elements of cherry and even blueberry, with a strong wood-spice scent. The palate is hearty with baked red currant and orange-rind flavors, made more complex by the dried sage, intriguing game and grippy tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2018 Sanford & Benedict Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked plum, muddled mulberry and cherry aromas are coated in oak and mesquite on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very cohesive, integrating roasted cherry and red-currant flavors with hints of oregano, vanilla and oak spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2018 Parker West Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Always a top flight wine at Harper Voit, this latest vintage from Bieze offers plenty of spicy flavors of strawberry pie with a side of raspberry compote. The tannins are polished and proportionate, and there's a refreshing wet rock minerality lingering through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2018 Bieze Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Württemberg, Germany
Description: There's a uniquely smoky, mineral intensity that pervades this full-bodied but sprightly red. Flavors of red cherry and raspberry are crisply concentrated and perfumed by swathes of tea leaf, rose petal and mint. While delicious now for its fresh, zingy fruit it's a wine that should improve through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schnaitmann 2017 Simonroth Spätburgunder (Württemberg)

Appellation: Rheinhessen, Germany
Description: The nose is quiet here suggesting trace hints of toast and smoky mineral, but the palate of this spry, fresh-footed Pinot Noir offers bold strokes of zippy black cherry and raspberry. Freshly concentrated and edged by fine-grained, silky tannins, it's a wine that's ready now but should drink beautifully through at least 2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wittmann 2018 Rotwein Trocken Spätburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A partnership between the families of Dan Kosta and Emeril Lagasse, this red blends together grapes from Campbell Ranch, Sunchase Vineyard and Gap's Crown. With bright red fruit and buzzy baking spice, it retains a taste of red-apple skin, woody pine resin and brooding acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: AldenAlli 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Enticing cinnamon and black-currant aromas are followed by mouthfilling, juicy black-cherry and raspberry flavors in this big but well-balanced wine. It offers gorgeous fruit, generous oak spices and a good, lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Black Kite 2017 Angel Hawk Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-cranberry and candied hibiscus aromas meet with this historic vineyard's hints of earth and game on the nose of this bottling. Leathery tannins frame the sip, where red-spice, raspberry, dried lemon and singed sagebrush flavors converge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2018 Sanford & Benedict 1971 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark red currants, pomegranate and raspberry aromas meet with a tarry earth minerality as well as tarragon and mint on the very layered nose of this bottling. There's a gamy streak on the palate that pairs well with raspberry-jam and raspberry-compote flavors, with orange rind, flowering herbs and muddled spice on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Biddle Ranch 2018 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fairly dark in the glass, this bottling from a historic vineyard offers the telltale hints of wet earth and light game as well as dark-fruit elements of cherry and even blueberry, with a strong wood-spice scent. The palate is hearty with baked red currant and orange-rind flavors, made more complex by the dried sage, intriguing game and grippy tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2018 Sanford & Benedict Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked plum, muddled mulberry and cherry aromas are coated in oak and mesquite on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very cohesive, integrating roasted cherry and red-currant flavors with hints of oregano, vanilla and oak spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2018 Parker West Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark blackberry aromas meet with rich chai spice and a slight hint of green herb on the nose of this bottling. Hearty flavors of dark berry and herb ride a bright acidity into a menthol-kissed finish, proving to be a big wine with all the textural fixings.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Piazza Family 2018 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy and precise, this punches through with blueberry, plum and cherry fruit, a seam of clean earth hinting at graphite, and a coffee-drenched, drying finish. It's a complex, layered, textured wine with excellent aging potential.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Alexana 2018 Crawford Beck Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from a 1998 planting now in its prime, this offers pretty scents and tastes of cherry fruit, hard cherry candy, candied orange and dried orange peel. Tannins are silky, and aging 11 months in 30% new French oak brings a touch of chocolate through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Élevée Winegrowers 2018 Élevée Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Smooth as silk, this estate-grown bottling mixes purple fruits and sweet spices. It gathers itself in the midpalate, with appealing concentration. The barrel aging adds a burst of coffee liqueur through the finish. Drink now and over the next half decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2017 Filament Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lush strawberry and cherry flavors highlight this evocative, pleasurable wine. Lightly peppery and annotated with baking spices, the lovely fruit is concentrated in the midpalate and carries on through an extended finish, which opens beautifully with ample aeration. The wine spent 18 months in 35% new oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2017 Bradshaw Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Mosel, Germany
Description: Delicate aromas of violet and fresh black cherry are intoxicating on the nose of this intensely fruity Pinot Noir. It's a profoundly ripe, robust expression of Mosel Pinot Noir studded with concentrated blackberry and plum flavors but it maintains a vitality throughout. While approachable now for its opulence and perfume it should drink well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maximin Grünhäuser 2018 Pinot Noir (Mosel)

Appellation: Chambolle-Musigny, Burgundy, France
Description: Grown close to the village, this ripe and perfumed wine is generous and developing great richness. It already has the elegance of a Chambolle while also having great structure. The wine is good for long-term aging. Wait to drink until 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gérard Seguin 2019 Derrière le Four  (Chambolle-Musigny)

Appellation: Gevrey-Chambertin, Burgundy, France
Description: Aged partially in new wood, this spicy, structured wine has great intensity. It is concentrated and rich, full of red fruits to go with the powerful, still-young tannins. Give this dense wine plenty of time and drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gérard Seguin 2019 Terroir du Domaine  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh black-raspberry and dark-cranberry aromas meet with crumple carnations, spice cake and a hint of earth on the nose of this bottling. It lands with a hearty mouthfeel on the palate, offering wild berry flavors that are balanced by thyme and oregano.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Soquel Vineyards 2019 Regan Vineyards Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Lavish ripe fruit flavors meet delicious baking-spice accents in this broad, smooth and mouthfilling wine. It's easy to love for the strawberry, and red- and black-cherry notes and the cinnamon, vanilla and cedar shadings from oak aging.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Black Kite 2018 Kites Rest Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a sublime, cool-climate red that is compelling in strawberry and dried herb. With a grip of oak and elegant power, it retains both enough acidity and elegance to cut through a full-bodied frame.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vaughn Duffy Wines 2018 Suacci Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This powerful and concentrated yet well-polished wine boasts a full body that's backed by moderate tannins. It combines ripe black cherry and plum flavors with subtle accents of baking spice. It's on the big, bold side of the Pinot spectrum.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ferrari-Carano 2019 Middleridge Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: All the hallmarks of Brian Loring's style are in this countywide blend, from beautifully ripe aromas of baked boysenberry to fresh lavender florals to warm notes of buttery pastry. Tension and freshness frame the sip, giving structure and vibrancy to the baked berry and vanilla flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Loring Wine Company 2019 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: There's a rich cloak of baking spices around pretty strawberry and cherry fruit flavors. The name tips you off that there may be some accent notes of seashells, which come up in the back of the palate as the wine rolls into a drying finish. The vineyard sources are unknown, but the flavors conjure up thoughts of Ribbon Ridge. Drink 2023–2033.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Andrew Rich 2018 Marine Sedimentary Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Just released, this wine remains sharp and spicy, with a nervous edginess. Punchy red fruits carry it, along with an underlying minerality. Give it some extra breathing time to put some additional flesh on it, or simply tuck it away for another year or two.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2018 Filament Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: This single-vineyard wine is richly structured, with fine tannins and solid, complex black fruits. The dry core comes from both the fruit and the wood aging. This ripe, full-bodied wine will be ready from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Cray 2019 Pinot Noir Le Cornevent  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump aromas of sour cherry are lifted by purple and red flowers and wrapped in a toasty oak presence on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There's cohesion of cranberry fruit and anise spice on the palate, with a fresh acidity throughout.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kynsi 2018 Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Intense, spicy oak flavors win the attention away from good, ripe black-fruit components in this full-bodied and smooth-textured wine blended from different California wine regions. Aged in 75% new French barrels, its black-cherry and almost jammy blackberry notes are wrapped in wood smoke, nutmeg, clove and cinnamon.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kosta Browne 2018 4-Barrel Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fruity and effusive in wild strawberry, red cherry and tart Meyer lemon, this is a light, refreshing and textured wine that is brightly delicious. It finishes in wet stone.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Saintsbury 2020 Vincent Vin Gris of Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Marin County, North Coast, California, US
Description: Great balance and a refreshing bit of restraint make this medium-bodied wine charming and elegant. It will be easy to come back to for all kinds of meals. Vibrant raspberry and red cherry meet light oak spices on a smooth, lightly tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: De Loach 2018 Stubbs Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marin County)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hearty aromas of roasted berries and plums meet with smoked meat on the nose of this bottling. The mouthfeel is full on the palate, where sanguine, oak and light pepper aspects pair well with the rich berry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Furthermore 2017 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Spicy mace aromas wrap around the roasted cherry and slight charcuterie aromas on the nose of this bottling. The structure is taut on the sip, with flavors of prosciutto woven around mulberry, roasted fig and plum.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2018 Older Barrels Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fairly light in the glass, this single-vineyard expression pops on the nose with fruit punch and cranberry aromas, dusted by wild sage and thyme. There's a tightness to the palate that laces around the brisk flavors of raspberry and wet stone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tread 2019 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This estate-grown wine is detailed and complex. It offers a mouthfilling texture filled with with brambly red-berry flavors wrapped in fresh acidity and moderate tannins. About 30% was aged in new barrels.                      Paul Gregutt
Designation: Domaine Estate Grown Made with Biodynamic Grapes
Name: King Estate 2017 Domaine Estate Grown Made with Biodynamic Grapes Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a full-throttle wine with muscular fruit and tannins that grab hold of the palate and don't let go. There's a seam of funky earth underlying ripe blackberry and black cherry fruits. A wash of espresso comes over the palate as the flavors linger on through a finish dusted with coffee. The wine was aged in 30% new oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lavinea 2018 Tualatin Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The latest reserve falls right in line with previous vintages, a full-bodied mix of blackberry, black cherry, black olive and light hints of sandalwood. It's full-flavored from start to finish, with loads of pure fruit power. It was aged in 40% new French oak, fully supported by ripe, almost silky tannins.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Soter 2018 North Valley Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune, Burgundy, France
Description: This rich wine with fine tannins and black fruits has great potential. Structured, balanced and with vibrant fruitiness, it will age well. Drink this stylish wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourgogne Devaux 2018 Le Clou  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is made from a site in Green Valley rich in Goldridge soils and planted to several marquee clones of the grape. Earthy layers of strawberry, raspberry and dried herb combine around a dense midpalate of notable tannin, dark-tea and edgy forest notes, the acidity buzzy throughout.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Typicité 2019 Big Pig Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh boysenberry and cranberry aromas are wrapped in a rusty iron note on the nose of this bottling. There's a tarry tone to the sip, which is firm in tension and offers flavors of black plum, lavender and cracked pepper.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Calera 2018 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Thick, leathery scents and tastes distinguish this wine, yet do not obliterate the full-flavored raspberry and cherry fruits. More leather, chocolate and hazelnut wrap up the finish. One-third was aged in new French oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Fullerton 2018 Fir Crest Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits, Burgundy, France
Description: This rich, densely textured wine is impressively ripe. Its tannins are still young and will sustain further development. With plenty of red cherry fruitiness to balance the structure, it will age further. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Dominique Guyon 2018 Les Dames de Vergy  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits, Burgundy, France
Description: Lightly smoky from wood aging this wine has ripe, juicy red-fruit flavors. While it is young, it is already delicious and packed with freshness and fruitiness. Drink from late 2021. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jean-Claude Boisset 2019  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The rocky minerality aspect takes center stage in this appellation blend, beginning with wet soil and gravel aromas as well as light cherry and strawberry on the nose. That leads to a tightly woven palate, where the earthy aspects open slowly to reveal pomegranate and oregano flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2019 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Plummy with notes of earthy dried herb, black tea and a contrast of vanilla, this vineyard-designate is firmly structured in tannin, with a sandy, grippy texture. High-toned hints of rose, violet and strawberry add lift and invitation.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Waypoint 2018 Brown Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light berry and cherry aromas are fresh, crisp and inviting on the nose of this wine, which also offers light vanilla and star anise notes. There is a decent structure to the palate, where strong acidity cuts against the fruity flavors, and baking spice warms the tart finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kynsi 2018 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Compelling minerality defines this cuvée, assembled from undisclosed vineyards. Bright raspberry fruit and supporting acidity emphasize the fresh, crisply defined palate. The flavors are young and the wine still tight, but quite enjoyable already. Give it some extra breathing time for optimal flavors.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Andrew Rich 2018 Volcanic Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Mosel, Germany
Description: Perfumed and fresh on its feet, this charming Pinot Noir is a fantastic bargain find. Red-cherry notes are pure and pristine from nose to finish, accented by cooling tones of crushed slate, wild mint and rose petal. It's a juicy wine edged by delicate tannins that drinks beautifully young but should hold well through 2030 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Günther Steinmetz 2018 Unfiltriert Pinot Noir (Mosel)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A delicate, gentle wine, this opens with pretty aromas of rose and raspberry. Similar flavors follow on the palate, along with a touch of orange peel. It's balanced, elegant and stylish, with some medium-term aging potential. Drink through 2028.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2017 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A price drop makes this more attractive than ever. It's a full-bodied, multi-vineyard blend, loaded with black cherry fruit and a splash of espresso. The mouthfeel is smooth and palate-coating, with just a hint of clean metal in the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2017 Strandline Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy red fruits are front and center in this red, with plum and cherry in full force. Still young and tightly wound, the acidity remains a bit sharp, putting the fruit into crisp focus. The wine was aged 18 months in 29% new oak, adding some pretty baking spices to the finish. Drink 2022–2028.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2017 Nicholas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine pushes the limits with ripe aromas, offering big black-cherry and balsamic notes followed by vibrant red- and black-fruit flavors on a mouthfilling, moderately tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Drew 2019 Morning Dew Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Refined and balanced, county appellation wine delivers great quality for a fair price. Juicy in pomegranate and rhubarb, it offers nicely savory notes of anise and black tea that persist around silky, lengthy tannin and integrated oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vaughn Duffy Wines 2018 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Marin County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This nicely balanced and well-concentrated wine offers focused fruit flavors of black cherry and black currant shaded by persimmon and rhubarb accents for a complex and appetizing profile. It's reasonably ripe, just slightly restrained in a good way and keeps demanding more sips.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Stubbs Vineyard 2019 Pinot Noir (Marin County)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This aromatic young wine opens with sniffs of blackberry and cola, and follows with plush flavors of the same, along with black cherry and a dusting of coffee. The palate offers a tangle of berries, a streak of cola, and textured tannins. Give it plenty of breathing time to open up through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Alexana 2018 Fennwood Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Ripe strawberry fruit touches on jam, along with lighter flavors of Bing cherry. It's an open, delicately herbal wine, with a peppery pop to the finish. One-third of the barrels were new.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Élevée Winegrowers 2018 Björnson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: For just the second time, the winery has made a select blend with barrels from its three single-vineyard expressions. Subtly herbal, with pretty red fruits and modest tannins, the proportions are all in sync and carry on through the finish. Three-fifths of the blend came from the Madrona Hill Vineyard, and two-thirds of the barrels were new.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Élevée Winegrowers 2018 Departure Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is principally Pommard clone and used one-quarter new barrels, pushing the richness and front-loading the fruit flavors. Tangerine, orange candy, raspberry and cherry lifesavers and more open it up nicely, then lead into a tart, compact finish. The acidity promises further aging, and this should drink well over the next six to eight years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Red Electric 2018 Armstrong Vineyard TGV Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits, Burgundy, France
Description: Although young, this wine is also well balanced. Its tannins and generous berry fruits harmonize well, giving a fresh, juicy character and a drier core. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Albert Bichot 2019 Les Dames Huguettes  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

Appellation: Fixin, Burgundy, France
Description: This dense and rich wine is packed with black fruits and ripe tannins. Wood aged, partially in new barrels, the wine does have spice but that is fully balanced by the concentrated fruits and final acidity. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gérard Seguin 2019 La Place  (Fixin)

Appellation: Sancerre, Loire Valley, France
Description: Fresh and juicy with mature richness, this single-vineyard wine comes from a three-acre parcel. Wood aged and spicy, the wine has cherry ripeness allied to a flavor that has now softened and filled out. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Le Graveron  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Chalone, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from a single block in this historic vineyard begins with suavely integrated aromas of plum, mulberry and light baking spice. The palate pairs rich cherry with vanilla, as chiseled tannins show just enough edge to deliver the ripe, spicy flavors into a warm pastry-like finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Armida 2018 Chalone Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A light entry brings up pretty fruit flavors of red berries and a wash of baking spices. There's a sweetness to this wine, which is aromatic, fruity, forward and open. What it initially seems to lack in depth it makes up in immediate appeal, and with ample aeration it puts some added meat on its bones, along with a light dusting of herbs. Drink now and over the next five years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Andrew Rich 2018 Eola Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Dark and rich, the black cherry fruit approaches the flavors of cassis. At first a bit high-toned with a sharp attack, this gently softens out into a lingering finish with chewy tannins. Some 40% was fermented with whole clusters, and 20% was aged in new oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carlton Hill 2018 Estate Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune, Burgundy, France
Description: Still with youthful tannins, this wine has a structure that will repay aging and softening. The texture is backed by ripe red-berry fruits, good acidity and richness. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourgogne-Devaux 2018 La Perrière  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine offers tart red fruit with plenty of power. Strawberry, raspberry and cherry are in the mix, buoyed by sappy acidity and peppery spice. It spent 18 months in 35% new French barrels, but there is little impression of barrel toast. Rather, the aging has helped to file down any rough tannic edges.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2017 Kennel Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: King Estate produces as many as 15 different Pinot Noirs in a single vintage. This wine is sourced from multiple vineyards, all Willamette Valley sites, and crafted into a standout example of the regional style. Supple, juicy berry and cherry fruits are accented by citrus highlights. The tannins are modest and the finish trails off with a nice touch of toast.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2018 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Still young and somewhat inscrutable, this hints at tart but still generic red berry fruit, lightly peppery and backed with moderate acidity. Rolling on through the midpalate it seems a bit diffuse, and lacks concentration as it fades. Nonetheless it's a well-balanced wine, with good potential and a drinking window now through the late 2020s.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lavinea 2018 Elton Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: All of Red Electric's Pinots are sourced from the same vineyard, and distinguished by the clonal mix. Here some 30% was whole-cluster fermented, and the flavors are layered and complex. Citrus skins, wild berries, a lick of pretty chocolate and young, stiff, lightly earthy tannins are all in the mix. The aging (17 months sur lie) included just 15% new barrels.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Red Electric 2018 Armstrong Vineyard The Pulse Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A value-priced companion to the winery's similarly designated Chardonnay, this offers clean, lightly spicy red fruits perched atop palate-piercing acidity. Pretty aromas include cranberries, moist earth and wet stems. In the mouth those flavors are complemented with light citrus, green tea and a thin seam of dark chocolate.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Walter Scott 2019 La Combe Verte Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoked meat, bloody steak, iodine and oak aromas surround the cranberry compote at the center of the nose of this bottling. The palate zips with acidity, smashing raspberry-fruit flavors into more rugged meat and smoke, with juniper and sage floating into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hitch 2019 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dried rose petal and herbes de Provence mingle on the nose of this wine, leading the way to an earthy, feral core of quality, gritty texture. The fruit is wild strawberry and pomegranate, crunchy and tangy in acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: La Pitchoune 2016 La Mission Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This full-bodied, blocky wine is composed of the winery's selection of its three best barrels, including one that is brand-new. The aromas touch on high-toned, while the flavors are of cherries and chocolate. The tannins are textured and chewy.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carlton Hill 2018 Estate Tournament Reserve Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This vineyard brings scents of dried Italian herbs, and flavors of sweet cherry tomatoes and Italian plums. Lighter suggestions of figs and a whiff of sandalwood add layers of complexity, though the overall impression is that it was picked just short of optimal ripeness.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Élevée Winegrowers 2018 Madrona Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This single-clone estate selection is sourced from own-rooted vines planted in 1992. It's fruity, clean and tightly focused, with pinpoint aromas and flavors of strawberry and raspberry. It was aged for 19 months in 30% new French oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Designation: On Your Own Clone 115 Estate Grown Certified Biodynamic
Name: King Estate 2017 On Your Own Clone 115 Estate Grown Certified Biodynamic Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This widely available bottling is sourced from vineyards scattered across the Willamette Valley. Aromatic and bright, the sassy raspberry fruit dominates nose and palate, with drying tannins echoing through the finish. It was aged in 20% new French oak for just under a year.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ponzi 2018 Tavola Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Earthy aromas of muddled mulberry, baked thyme and a touch of game show on the nose of this bottling. There's a tight cranberry flavor to the palate, drizzled with sage oil, sprinkled with incense shavings and touched by that roasted game element.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Martin Ranch 2018 J.D. Hurley R.E.D Vineyards Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This nervy wine combines an earthy, flinty aroma with good red cherry and rhubarb as well as a touch of metallic tang. It is definitely worth trying for the wine's complexity and visceral, mineral personality. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Vie Winery 2018 Pinot Noir (North Coast)

Appellation: Mt. Harlan, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried strawberry aromas meet with light leather, dried mud, seasoning salt and wild herbs on the nose of this bottling. There is a firm tension to the sip, where tart cranberry flavors soak into the meatier, forest-floor aspects.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Calera 2017 Mills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: In this midprice range some really good options for Willamette Valley Pinot can be found, this among them. Supple and rich with mixed berries, plum jam and a hint of pepper, it's backed with citrus-inflected acidity. Still young and tart, it's a wine to enjoy over the rest of the decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Alexana 2018 Terroir Series Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Finished dry, this is a particularly fruity style, with a big burst of juicy apple flavors in the center. Full-bodied and annotated with citrusy acidity, it acquires a lovely creamy character as it settles into the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carlton Hill 2019 Estate Rosé of Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Bourgogne Côtes d’Auxerre, Burgundy, France
Description: This is a bold, rich wine, a surprise from this far north in Burgundy. It does, however, carry the weight of alcohol well, giving a wine that has density and a chance to age. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Felix 2018 Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne Côtes d’Auxerre)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune, Burgundy, France
Description: This estate in the Côte Chalonnaise has made a well-structured wine with ripe red fruits and a core of young, maturing tannins. The wine's dry core will soften, transforming into richness and great fruitiness. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Cray 2019  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits, Burgundy, France
Description: Packed with swathes of red fruits, this generous, fruity wine is approaching maturity. Succulent acidity goes well with the light structure and refreshing fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Dominique Guyon 2017 Les Dames de Vergy  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

Appellation: Bourgogne Côte d’Or, Burgundy, France
Description: From vines in the valley just outside Gevrey-Chambertin, this wine is structured, full in the mouth. Textured red fruits and acidity are tempered by wood aging that gives the wine extra richness and potential. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Laborde 2018 Au Prunier Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne Côte d’Or)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: This producer based in Meursault has made a freshly juicy wine with crisp acidity and bright red fruits. Freshness makes a good contrast with the core of tannins. Drink this attractive wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vincent Girardin 2018 Cuvée Saint-Vincent Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This well-balanced, well-structured and handsomely complex wine emphasizes ripe plum and red-cherry flavors and accents them with subtle cinnamon, cedar and mint notes. Light tannins and a medium to full body lend a mouthfilling texture while lively acidity adds a fresh lift.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ferrari-Carano 2019 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried strawberry, root beer spice, hibiscus and a hint of wood show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a more flashy affair, with sour cherry, cranberry and orange rind flavors, leading into a slight hint of mushroom on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kessler-Haak 2016 Block 6 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Marlborough, New Zealand
Description: Once this gets a bit of air, whether in glass or decanter, it proves to be an appealing, if ripe, Pinot, with notes of strawberry and raspberry jam, soft spices, florals and a mushroomy underbelly. On the palate, plush fruit dominates but it's more brambly and currant-y here, wound by fine, sappy, spicy tannins. Easy to drink now but should gain more complexity over the next several years.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Baron Edmond de Rothschild 2017 Rimapere Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The engaging scents of musky red and purple fruits compel further exploration. It's laced with subtle flavors of dried herbs, chipotle and matted leaves, with a core of tart cherry fruit. Sealed with a screw cap, this exceptional value should hold up well for the rest of this decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Andrew Rich 2018 Prelude Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: McMinnville, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Some sweet spice from aging in 30% new French oak frames up the pretty rose petal and cherry fruit flavors. Though it's a light wine in weight and persistence, the alcohol nears 14%. This is the best of the 2018s from Coelho, enjoyable now and through the next half decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Coelho 2018 Delfina Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tart and acidity-driven, this is an unusual example of this vineyard, especially in this excellent vintage. Many Temperance Hill wines seem more generous with their fruit. Here there's a whiff of funk and plenty of citrus, along with mixed flavors of purple fruits leading into astringent, tea-like tannins. Give this ample aeration to help open it up.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lavinea 2018 Temperance Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune, Burgundy, France
Description: This producer has made a richly evocative wine, bringing out the cool edge of wines from the hills behind Beaune while also having balanced richness and a tannic edge. Drink this wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Nicolas Potel 2019  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune

Appellation: Marsannay, Burgundy, France
Description: Partially matured in new wood, this wine shows plenty of toastiness. The fruit is developing a succulent, structured richness that gives the wine a good future. From a single vineyard in the northernmost of the Côtes de Nuits vineyards, the wine will be ready from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gérard Seguin 2019 En Batayard  (Marsannay)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This coastal wine combines grapes from Carneros, Petaluma Gap and the Russian River Valley, blending the nuances of each into an impressive array of forested, savory earthiness and rich red fruit. Textured and offering balanced weight, it finishes in a blur of black tea.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Typicité 2019 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's an appealing earthy and gamy funk to the nose of this bottling, which pairs a charcuterie scent with fresh, dark berries. Roasted cranberry flavors pop on the palate, where thyme and oregano also show atop the dried lamb and roast beef elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Glunz 2018 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Made from the Pommard clone, this brings a mix of cranberry, raspberry, plum and cherry fruit flavors, set upon a spine of stem tannins. Some 40% of the ferment was whole cluster, and all the oak used was neutral. The sturdy finish suggests midterm ageability. The fruit mix is excellent, the balance spot-on, and the value speaks for itself.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Trathen Hall 2018 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Earthy aromas of dried shiitake, soy and iron meet with cola and dried cherry on the nose of this bottling. It zips with acidity on the palate, cutting into the sandalwood and cedar flavors, with a sour cherry core.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Furthermore 2017 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Opening in divine aromatics of orange peel and raspberry, this cool-climate wine shows a length of brightness and fresh acidity amidst a full-bodied style and approach. Ample tannin and oak accentuate its earthier, heartier side.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Buena Vista 2018 Geza's Selection Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With an opening of rich, robust toasted oak and a length of seductive raspberry, cherry and marshmallow, this wine finds its balance on the midpalate, complementing those richer tones with earthy dried herb, forest floor and a hint of cola. It offers length and breadth with bright, underlying acidity.                      Virginie Boone
