Name: Keltom Roots 2019 Morchella Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: A relatively light color and a smoky auburn rim lead to mature, mellow, almost buttery aromas and then to a smooth palate laced with mulled strawberry and cherry flavors accented by walnuts and beef jus. With no need for further aging, this wine shows what a nicely mature Pinot can taste like.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Brooks Note 2017 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted black-plum, vanilla-touched oak and smoke aromas make for a hearty nose on this bottling. Smoked cherry and berry flavors meet with savory pork roast on the sip, where the oak is strong but judiciously employed.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2018 Ashley's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fairly subtle aromas of baked cherry, mace, fresh pomegranate and oak come through on the nose of this appellation blend. Flavors of baked cherry, slight bitter orange and damp mushrooms arise on the sip, which is tightly wound and offers a touch of toast on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Soquel Vineyards 2019 Partners' Reserve Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This lively, fruity and deliciously nervy wine is jazzed up by tasty raspberry and red-cherry flavors on light tannins and snappy acidity. It feels medium bodied and there is plenty of ripeness to balance the tangy structure.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fulcrum 2019 On Point Winemakers Selection Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This was given 14 months in 40% new French oak, and the high alcohol also indicates the winemaker's target style. It's a big, bold, muscular, tannic wine, with an abundance of ripe berry fruit. Don't look for typical Pinot Noir finesse—this comes on sharp, hot and fruity.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Averaen 2018 Flood Line Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Ripe, round and fruity, this is bursting with ripe cherry fruit that carries cleanly into a medium-long finish. There's a touch of mineral underscoring the tannins, and as with all of Drew Voit's wines, the balance is spot-on.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2018 Strandline Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The name plays on the fact that this single-clone selection comes from a high point in the estate vineyards, just shy of 1,200 feet in elevation. Pretty flavors focus on tart red berries alongside sly hints of rhubarb, green tea and chocolate. It was whole-cluster fermented and finished in 30% new oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Designation: Just Shy Clone 113 Estate Grown Made with Biodynamic Grapes
Name: King Estate 2017 Just Shy Clone 113 Estate Grown Made with Biodynamic Grapes Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The pretty rose hue, hinting at a light tawny shade at the rim, indicates that this wine is in a prime drinking window. It was barrel-aged for a full two years, lending the fruit flavors a more mature profile. Think cherry cobbler, with the wine's tannins sanded smooth. It's of moderate scale but balanced, with accents of sandalwood. A lovely bottle at this price that should be consumed over the next year or two.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Zimri Cellars 2017 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Crisp red fruit and citrus notes make way for a cool-climate experience of nuanced elegance and power in this medium-bodied red from the famous site. Black tea, forest and nutmeg add to the complexity and contrast, buzzing with acidity throughout.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bruliam 2018 Gap's Crown Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Demure fruit highlights a silky body of delicate, varietal layers in this well-made wine. Rounded, it offers a balanced approach to richness, an exploration of dark cherry, pomegranate and forest floor.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fort Ross Vineyard 2018 Sea Slopes Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked boysenberry and plum flavors are bolstered by mace, nutmeg and vanilla on the spicy nose of this bottling. Unctuous fruit flavors of black raspberry are layered with leather on the palate, where soft tannins make for a rich sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Loring Wine Company 2019 Aubaine Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A rich nose of baked plum and cherry leads the way to a midpalate of earthy forest and meaty concentration. Structured and bright, it finishes in a wash of firm, pronounced tannin and toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cultivar 2018 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark, rich and showing the pleasantly musty hints of age on the nose, this bottling begins with baked plum and crumpled earth aromas. The tannins are still quite tight and the acid still pumps on the palate, where aged plum and berry flavors meet with a leathery tone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kessler-Haak 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune, Burgundy, France
Description: This rich, full-bodied wine is firm with tannins while also celebrating bright cherry fruits. It is a ripe wine, succulent with acidity and held together with a good structure. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Antonin Rodet 2019 Château de Mercey Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune, Burgundy, France
Description: This single-vineyard wine is rich and spicy, with black-cherry flavors to partner with the solid structure. The balance is there and this wine just needs to develop further. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Berger-Rive 2018 Manoir de Mercey Au Paradis  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bold and dark-cherry aromas near boysenberry on the nose of this bottling, which also shows nutmeg and snickerdoodle spices. Cherry and plum flavors pick up those baking-spice touches on the palate as well.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Paradise Springs 2018 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: This fruity, lightly textured wine has ripe red-cherry and berry flavors. Balanced with some tannic dryness and lots of juicy acidity, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Maison Roche de Bellene 2018 Cuvée Réserve Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: This ripe wine has plenty of tannins to balance the perfumed red fruits. Structured and dense, the wine is rich with fruits and freshened by final acidity. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Nicolas Potel 2019 Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Year in and year out this winery overdelivers at budget-friendly prices. This is a credentialed Pinot Noir with real power. There's black cherry fruit at the center, and just-ripe tannins that leave a hint of tea. You may pick up a smoky scent that carries into the finish, and it should be remembered that there was smoke in some vineyards during this vintage. But barrels are smoky also, and all the components of this wine work synergistically. Drink now and over the next two or three years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Samuel Robert 2019 Family Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This Pinot Nero opens with aromas of red-skinned berries, underbrush and cedar. The juicy, savory palate offers crushed raspberry, cinnamon and clove alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Podere Monastero 2018 La Pineta Pinot Nero (Toscana)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the mountain site, this is an earthy, savory and structured red wine, offering demure red fruit and a hint of orange peel. Dried herb, black-tea and forest tones dominate on the midpalate around grippy tannin.                      Virginie Boone
Name: La Pitchoune 2016 Van Der Kamp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy, peppery and loaded with cranberry and briary berry fruit, this seems custom made for roast fowl. It's bright and fresh, with a drying, grippy finish that brings up latent minerality and a finishing wash of toasted cracker. It definitely wants to accompany something rich, whether an oily salmon or a roast duck.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Coelho 2018 Coelho Estates Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune, Burgundy, France
Description: This is a rich and soft wine, with succulent red fruits and a hint of concentration that promises well for the future. It is ripe, with a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2019 Closerie des Alisiers  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

Appellation: Baden, Germany
Description: Whiffs of burnt caramel and toast lend charry, savory undertones to crisp cranberry and red-cherry flavors here. Full bodied but fresh in fruit profile, it's a zesty, briskly concentrated Pinot Noir at peak now through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Salwey 2016 Dry Pinot Noir (Baden)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: Aged in wood, this wine shows richness as well as a light touch of red-berry fruits and acidity. It has structure, a dry core that gives the wine some potential. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Bitouzet-Prieur 2018 Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Bourgogne Côte d’Or, Burgundy, France
Description: This new appellation, a step up from Bourgogne Rouge, can deliver some well-structured wines, as this release shows. Combined with the fresh red-berry fruits and good acidity, the wine bursts with structured energy. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Jean Guiton 2018 Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne Côte d’Or)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This blended cuvée incorporates fruit from selected barrels from six different vineyards. Leather, cherry and tart acidity are its hallmarks. It's rather austere and should be aerated and enjoyed through 2023.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2017 Backbone Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The boysenberry and black-cherry aromas are very inviting on the nose of this bottling, which also shows a tarragon kick. The red-plum core of the palate is lifted by tea-leaf and pine-needle flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Asuncion Ridge 2017 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: This Beaune-based negociant house has made a richly dense wine that is packed with succulent black fruits and freshened with acidity. It is a satisfying wine, ripe and with a balanced structure. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chanson Père et Fils 2019 Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits, Burgundy, France
Description: This rich, perfumed wine has dark fruits, ripe tannins and plenty of potential. Fresh red fruits shine in this balanced wine that will be ready from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2019  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich and fairly extracted aromas of baked cherry, cola and star anise power the nose of this bottling. Toasty flavors of black-plum sauce and baking spice show on the darkly flavored palate, which has a bit of tang toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Loring Wine Company 2019 Quinta Santa Rosa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick in tannin and black cherry, this tiny-production wine offers aromas of rose petal, forest and tea, light on its feet in balanced ripeness and acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: La Pitchoune 2016 Holder Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Rully, Burgundy, France
Description: From the Côte Chalonnaise, this wine has richness along with a perfumed character. Red-berry fruits have a tangy edge, while spice adds to the touch of pepper. With its young, forward fruit, the wine needs to age, so drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Defaix Frères 2019  Rully

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune, Burgundy, France
Description: Structured and with layers of tannins, this wine has a fine future. The black fruits, mineral edge and concentration are further signs that this wine will age. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles Père et Fille 2019 La Combotte  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: It's rare to find a vineyard-designated Ribbon Ridge Pinot at this price. Firm and tight, with an earthy, herbal frame, this offers a balanced mix of wild berry, sour cherry and orange peel components. Roughly one-fifth was whole cluster fermented, and new oak was just 8%.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Red Electric 2018 Armstrong Vineyard Interurban Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: This wine is richly textured, with hints of fine tannins and succulent red fruits. Wood aged and ripe, this wine is set to mature well. Drink from late 2021. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jean-Claude Boisset 2019 Les Ursulines Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Bourgogne Côte d’Or, Burgundy, France
Description: This appellation covers some of the vineyards that used to be classified as just Bourgogne. The result is some fine wines, like this one, that have extra oomph, structure and concentration. With rich berry fruits, this wine will be ready from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Louis Jadot 2018  Bourgogne Côte d’Or

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: With a complexity of firm tannin and salty oak, this full-bodied wine exudes jammy red fruit, perfumed gingerbread and notes of cola and black tea. It is concentrated and undeniably rich.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hess 2019 Allomi Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune, Burgundy, France
Description: From a vineyard in the hills between Monthélie and Volnay, this wine, partially aged in new oak, is ripe, structured and has rich promise. The succulent red fruits, cut with acidity, are still shiny, but will soften well. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Laborde 2018 En Cuillery  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With full-bodied intensity and a showing of oak and tannin that persists through the midpalate, this wine finds balance and complexity in its undertones of dried herb and earthiness. Traces of strawberry, raspberry and citrus accent the silky finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Poundstone 2018 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is textured, complex and rich—a good showcase for the appellation. Dense layers of dark cherry and strawberry complement the earthier tones of black tea, forest floor and rhubarb, ending in a robust finish of toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vaughn Duffy Wines 2018 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very tart and tangy on the nose, this single-vineyard expression starts with pomegranate juice and orange-rind aromas. There is a sharp acidity to the palate, where the tart red fruit warms up to some oaky spice by the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stockwell 2017 Muns Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A light shade of pink in the glass, this bottling begins with soft bubblegum and creamy peach aromas. Ample wet stone tension frames the sip, where mandarin orange and peach flavors converge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alma de Cattleya 2020 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The Barrel Select gets double the barrel time (21 months) of the companion Estate bottling, and seems to show some new barrel toast flavors around the edges. The mixed clone fruit is tart and mixes lemony citrus with lightly ripened red berries.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cardwell Hill 2018 Barrel Select Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling begins with sage, bay-leaf and eucalyptus-tea aromas alongside a tart cranberry tone. Snappy red-currant flavors are wrapped in those same menthol-like herbs on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stockwell 2017 Regan Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rusty aromas of tart cherry meet with wild mint, thyme, pine and forest floor on the engaging nose of this bottling. The wild cherry and sagebrush combination shines on the palate, which is refreshing, zippy and pleasantly tart.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Allan Hancock 2019 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The wine from this much-loved Eola-Amity Hills vineyard shows medium concentration, with pleasing flavors of strawberry, cherry and a streak of lemon oil. Aged 14 months in 30% new oak, it should benefit from another year or two of bottle age. Drink through 2023.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2017 Temperance Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A classy package adorns this affordable wine. Cranberry and black cherry fruit come to a solid, focused core, with stiff acidity backing substantial yet smooth tannins.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2019 Inscription Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a forward, tasty, fruit-driven style, loaded with fresh strawberries and raspberries. It opens broadly across the palate, lightly dappled with suggestions of popcorn and grain. Not for the cellar, but definitely for the table, it should be at its drinking best during the next three or four years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Averaen 2019 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: A blend from several parcels on an estate in the Côte de Nuits, this wine is rich in tannic structure as well as generous black fruits. With its concentration and ripeness, the wine is set to age. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaines Devillard 2018 Domaine des Perdrix Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune, Burgundy, France
Description: This wine is fresh, shot through with red-berry fruits and tannins that give a dry edge. Still young, the wine promises good balance as it matures. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Maison Chanzy 2019  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine offers fresh strawberry aromas, nicely concentrated and ripe black-cherry flavors and a good, slightly tannic texture that keeps coming back for more. Good balance and a nice vibrance help it stand out.                      Jim Gordon
Name: MacRostie 2018 Day Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Extreme ripeness and concentration make this a big, bold wine despite its medium body. It shows black-currant and black-cherry aromas, attractive, clean and slightly tangy black-fruit flavors and a nice touch of tannin.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Drew 2019 Wendling Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's noticeable oak influence on the nose of this bottling, whose toasty frame coats the baked plum and turned earth flavors. The wood spice carries into the sip as well, imparting vanilla, sandalwood and light caramel notes, with a core of baked cranberry compote.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2018 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Auxey-Duresses, Burgundy, France
Description: Aged in new and old barrels, this wine has young tannins as well as vibrant, youthful red fruits. With its ripeness and dense fruitiness the wine has a jammy edge. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Henri Latour et Fils 2019 La Premier Cru  (Auxey-Duresses)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling begins with sage, bay-leaf and eucalyptus-tea aromas alongside a tart cranberry tone. Snappy red-currant flavors are wrapped in those same menthol-like herbs on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stockwell 2017 Regan Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Bourgogne Côte d’Or, Burgundy, France
Description: With elegant tannins and rich black fruits, this is a ripe, structured wine. It is young, bursting with vitality, acidity and textured fruitiness. Give it a few months and drink this wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Albert Bichot 2019 Sécret de Famille  (Bourgogne Côte d’Or)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: This rich, full wine is endowed with ripe berry flavors and a core of tannins. With its ripeness, the wine will be attractively drinkable as it matures. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Maison Champy 2019 Cuvée Edme Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's no wonder that the warmer climates of Paso Robles produce riper styles of Pinot Noir, but that's perfectly pleasant for those craving fruit. This bottling begins with cherry compote, cola candy and vanilla on the nose, leading into a full palate of generous spice-cake flavors that weave through the richer cherry and orange rind elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sculpterra 2018 Estate Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black raspberry and kirsch aromas meet with chaparral scrub on the nose of this bottling. There is a pleasing cohesion of cinnamon and cherry on the palate, where a strong acidity pumps to the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Asuncion Ridge 2017 Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Reductive at first, with pronounced notes of oak, this wine becomes slithery and seductively rich on the palate in flavors of wild strawberry and raspberry. Black tea, nutmeg and forest tones add to its complex edginess.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lion's Head 2019 Panthera Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark black-plum aromas are quite ripe on the nose, where loamy earth and wet sagebrush add more elegant layers. The rich plum and stewed mulberry flavors snap with acidity on the palate, where they are decorated with sage and mint elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Loring Wine Company 2019 Boekenoogen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This bold wine is a bit reductive on the nose, showing a grip of oak and tannin that takes time to settle. Herbal, earthy and robust, it offers flavors of dark cherry, raspberry and black licorice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Marimar 2017 Cristina Don Miguel Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This block selection reflects the winery's overall style—plenty of toasty flavors over rather light, pleasant red fruits. It's balanced and reaches a focus midpalate, but the overall lightness suggests drinking up over the next three or four years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cardwell Hill 2017 Dijon Blocks Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried cherry, earth and dried mushroom aromas show on the nose of this well-priced bottling. Tart cranberry flavors meet with crumpled thyme and sage on the palate, as well as some loamy earth.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Golden 2018 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an inaugural release from the producer's estate, a tight, reductive expression that will take time to unfurl. Earthy in black tea, forest and a midpalate intensity, it reveals layers of bright, lively red fruit, a mix of raspberry, strawberry and cherry that gives it a lasting freshness. Enjoy best from 2025–2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donum 2018 Three Hills Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy and supple, this red offers a generous helping of blue fruit matched by bright acidity. On the palate, it is lengthy, lush and textured, with accents of crushed rock, cardamom, nutmeg and white pepper. This showcases the site and vintage in a balanced, graceful wine.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Three Sticks 2018 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a single-block reserve wine from the producer's Russian River Valley estate. Waxy in texture, it offers densely concentrated waves of blood orange, strawberry and dark cherry, the fruit dusted in sage, dried herb and lavender. With length and considerable breadth, it begs for further aging and will benefit greatly. Enjoy best from 2028–2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donum 2018 Heritage Clones Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Wide, broad and fleshy, with an intensity of forest, black tea and cardamom, this wine is burly in tannin structure and dense concentration. The fruit is tangy and lush—a mix of black raspberry, plum and rhubarb that blend effortlessly with a wealth of toasted oak, nutmeg and vanilla. Grippy in its youth, enjoy best from 2028–2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donum 2018 Mikado Tree Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the mighty Hyde Vineyards, this red is seamless, delicious and memorable, full of impressive structure and grip. Black tea, strawberry and a juicy midpalate of darker fruit and baking spice give weight and complexity to the whole, boosted by fresh, persistent acidity and a hint of chocolate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Davies 2018 Hyde Vineyards Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's tremendous purity to the red cherry and hibiscus aromas on the nose of this bottling, which also shows aromas of bay leaf and dried herbs. The texture is immediately compelling on the sip, where rich cherry flavors are sprinkled with black tea, cardamom and coriander.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Spear 2018 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Simultaneously tight on the edges but plush in the center on the nose, this bottling shows full waves of plum, black raspberry and dark hibiscus as well as crushed stone and cinnamon-spice aromas. That red spice meets with star anise on the sip, where tart pluot and plum flavors mesh into lavender and violet to make a very complex experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Barden 2018 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Making single-vineyard wines from beyond the estate is a new strategy for Calera, but one that succeeds wildly here. Clean aromas of boysenberry jam, crushed rocks, light baking spice and desiccated pork show on the nose, while the full-flavored palate is both rustic and elegant, ranging from light brushes of licorice and ripe berry flavors to a firm tannic frame.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Calera 2018 Chalone Vineyard Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A rose potpourri aroma is wrapped around ripe cherries on the nose, spiced with a touch of mace and made further complex by a hint of game. The wood-spice character of the palate plays with wild berry and cherry, as tight tannins and biting acidity lead into a roasted-pork-kissed finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Caraccioli 2018 Escolle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a small, west-facing portion of the producer's estate vineyard, this is a thick, muted and earthy red wine that takes time to unfurl. As it does, it offers graphite, coffee-bean and rich raspberry and strawberry flavors, the tannins deeply structured and laced in dark chocolate and toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donum 2018 West Slope Single Block Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Peppercorns and bay leaf kick off the nose of this block designate, and are then followed by roasted strawberry and tangy raspberry touches before a crushed rock minerality takes hold. There is a firm texture to the palate, where alpine-strawberry and ripe plum flavors are wrapped in a rocky veil. Drink now thorough 2037.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Henry Ayrton's Block Rapley Trail Vineyard
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 Henry Ayrton's Block Rapley Trail Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a small, west-facing portion of the producer's estate vineyard, this is a thick, muted and earthy red wine that takes time to unfurl. As it does, it offers graphite, coffee-bean and rich raspberry and strawberry flavors, the tannins deeply structured and laced in dark chocolate and toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donum 2018 West Slope Single Block Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Driven by acidity and mineral-like complexity and texture, this cuvée is smooth and supple in texture, with a balanced style of richness and vibrancy. Tree-bark, pomegranate and tangerine flavors provide a contrast between savory elements and fruit, coalescing completely on the long finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Three Sticks 2018 Cuvée Eva Marie Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh black raspberry, hibiscus and sumac carry the nose of this expressive bottling, which gains complexity from an accent of fennel pollen. The snappy berry and plum-skin flavors meet with rose petals and cinnamon on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lightpost 2019 Saveria Vineyards Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tart black raspberry meets with crumpled oregano and dry, earthy loam on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard on the western edge of the appellation. There is a tight texture on the palate, where muddled plum, brisk berry and light chaparral flavors dance across the tongue.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Amor Fati 2018 Murmur Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Impressive amounts of game and wet soil flash across the nose on this bottling at first, before the pepper, plum and pomegranate elements fill in. The palate is equally complex, showing more game and soil as well as thyme, peppercorns, rich strawberry and tart cranberry on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Foley 2018 Rancho Santa Rosa Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh black raspberry, hibiscus and sumac carry the nose of this expressive bottling, which gains complexity from an accent of fennel pollen. The snappy berry and plum-skin flavors meet with rose petals and cinnamon on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lightpost 2019 Saveria Vineyards Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and inviting on the nose, this block-designated bottling begins with aromas of strawberry compote, citrus rind and dewy forest herbs. Refreshing strawberry and red-melon flavors pop on the palate, surrounded by oregano, marjoram, bay leaf, white-pepper and pine-resin touches.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Spear 2018 Block 13 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a savory, earthy and truly expressive site, evocative of its high-elevation coastal site. Black tea, forest floor and quenching acidity support citrus overtones that complement the wild strawberry and raspberry at its elegant core, with a wealth of well-integrated finishing tannin.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flowers 2018 Sea View Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked strawberry, cherry compote, cinnamon-stick and chai aromas swirl into a very heady, inviting and attention-grabbing nose on this single-vineyard expression. There's tingling acidity on the palate, cutting through the rounded cherry-cream flavors and leading into tighter red-plum, fennel and clove touches.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alma Rosa 2018 La Encantada Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sumptuous in strawberry, blackberry and nutmeg spice, with prominent tannin structure, this is a balanced wine sourced from enviable sites such as Hallberg, Rochioli and Martaella. Orange peel, black tea and dried herb accent a creamy, decadent texture that is never weighted down, boosted by buzzy acidity throughout.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gary Farrell 2018 Russian River Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Dazzling spicy aromas and vibrant black-fruit flavors converge beautifully in this bold but balanced wine. Scents of wood smoke, toasted oak, cardamom and black pepper meet black cherry, aged beef and blueberry on the palate, buoyed by moderate tannins and subtle nervy acidity. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Goldeneye 2017 Ten Degrees Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tightly wound in strong, powerful tannin, this vineyard-designate shows coastal intensity and savory elements of earth, black tea and forest floor. The fruit is subtle in cranberry and rhubarb, with a wisp of orange peel that lingers and adds brightness to the full-bodied style.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Crescere 2017 Platt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Cienega Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp raspberry and pomegranate aromas are dusted with light herbs, wet earth and forest-mushroom touches on the nose of this bottling, which is light in the glass. A similarly complex combination pops on the sip, with plum and cranberry, dried and fresh herbs and even cracked pepper spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Seabold Cellars 2018 Eden Rift North Slope Pinot Noir (Cienega Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-cherry and black-raspberry aromas meet with loads of crushed slate and dried loam as well as hibiscus and rosewater on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The palate is also very rocky and mineral-driven, while showing darker plum and purple-flower flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stephen Ross 2018 Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge, South Africa
Description: An aroma of lightly toasted oak gives way to scents of brambly berry, raspberry sauce and cherry pie on the nose of this enticing Pinot. The palate is medium in weight and satiny in feel, with more ripe red fruit tones that are framed by plush but structured tannins and ample acidic lift to keep the finish bright. Baking spice and forest floor tones grace the enduring finish, along with a touch of sweet orange oil.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Storm 2018 Ridge Pinot Noir (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-raspberry-jam, rose-petal and lilac aromas meet with a wet rock minerality on the nose of this single- vineyard expression. The palate is loaded with those rocky flavors of gravel, granite and sandstone, settling into rich boysenberry and spice tones of star anise and clove.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 Rapley Trail Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong aromas of roasted plum and mulberry meet with fresh pomegranate, dark cocoa spice and dried meat on the layered and inviting nose of this reserve bottling. The dried meat element takes on a rustic tone on the sip, baked by more mulberry and an acidity that slices into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Two Sisters 2018 Lindsay's Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Chalone, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Elegantly floral aromas of lavender and violet meet with cola spice and mulberry on the nose of this bottling, which manages to tame the appellation's common need for extended aging into an approachable, ready-to-drink style. The palate is full of rose petal and purple-flower potpourri flavors, with unique touches of blueberry and a hint of pepper on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Seabold Cellars 2018 Brosseau The Swale Pinot Noir (Chalone)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This nervy, appetizing and tightly balanced wine holds back a bit from complete ripeness to bring out tangy red- and black-cherry aromas, raspberry and cranberry flavors and a moderately tannic texture on a medium body. Made with native yeast, 45% of whole clusters and one-third new French barrels, it's a great showing in a slightly restrained style.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wentworth 2019 Nash Mill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is remarkably refined and elegant in style, with enduring freshness beneath the grip and bluster. Earthy black tea and a perfume of rose combine around a depth of wild strawberry, raspberry and pomegranate, remaining crisp and focused through a lengthy finish of cardamom.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ram's Gate 2018 El Diablo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of lavender potpourri, dried meat and baked black plum make for a heady, inviting nose in this bottling. The palate is cohesive and well-integrated, offering hints of roasted tomato, baked plum, thyme and oregano, with an elegant acidity that cuts through the rich mouthfeel.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lincourt 2017 Rancho Santa Rosa Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoked cherry, turned earth, mushroom, singed pine and a hint of maple show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard 2,000 feet high. The palate begins with a tart raspberry and pomegranate flavor, then picks up floral tones of lavender and rose petal, with hints of game and rosemary arising by the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 Windy Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This grand, full-bodied wine offers great concentration and a gorgeous combination of ripe red and black fruits and seductive baking spices. A rather deep color and generous black-cherry and strawberry aromas lead to a palate of almost jammy flavors. This is, perhaps, the best of an outstanding 2018 Pinot Noir lineup from Foursight.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Foursight 2018 Charles Vineyard Clone 5 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe Bing cherry and fruit-punch aromas meet with caramel tones of oak on the inviting nose of this bottling. The palate is quite toasty as well, loaded with mace and cinnamon spice that gives depth to the crisp and bright red fruits.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alma Rosa 2018 Rancho La Vina Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This grand, full-bodied wine offers great concentration and a gorgeous combination of ripe red and black fruits and seductive baking spices. A rather deep color and generous black-cherry and strawberry aromas lead to a palate of almost jammy flavors. This is, perhaps, the best of an outstanding 2018 Pinot Noir lineup from Foursight.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Foursight 2018 Charles Vineyard Clone 5 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap-Marin County, North Coast, California, US
Description: Nervy but also nicely flavorful, this tautly balanced wine marries just-ripe black-cherry and rhubarb flavors with good acidity, light tannins and plenty of complexity. Nuances of black tea, forest floor and cardamom give plenty to appreciate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kendric Vineyards 2019 Loup Solitaire Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap-Marin County)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge, South Africa
Description: There's a stony, earthy, almost granitic aspect to this wine's aroma, grounded by forest-spiced blueberry and boysenberry tones. The palate is plush and velvety in feel, with medium tannins and ample acidity that match the fruit intensity in perfect tandem. The finish is medium in length and currently fruit-driven, though the earthy elements underneath suggest further evolution and maturation to benefit. Drink after 2024.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Storm 2016 Ridge Pinot Noir (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

Appellation: Tasmania, Tasmania, Australia
Description: Tamar Ridge is one of Tasmania's biggest wineries (relative compared with some of Oz's mainland giants) yet it rarely skimps on quality. This Pinot is an excellent example, showcasing the density yet elegance of Tassie's north. It is a well of flavor: tangy red currant and blueberry fruit underpinned by earthy, savory notes like cured meat, five-spice powder and graphite. The elegance arrives on the medium-weight palate thanks to its rapier acidity. It feels porous, like it's running through granules of sand, but also focused: a dance between acidity and unique tannin structure. A distinctly Tassie wine to drink now until 2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Tamar Ridge 2018 Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Leather, dried strawberry and peppercorn lead into a nose loaded with chaparral spice of light thyme and sage on this vineyard designate. It's a bit shy on the palate at first, and then light cranberry and raspberry flavors emerge against the crushed stone and light red-flower flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 Will's Cabin Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge, South Africa
Description: There's a stony, earthy, almost granitic aspect to this wine's aroma, grounded by forest-spiced blueberry and boysenberry tones. The palate is plush and velvety in feel, with medium tannins and ample acidity that match the fruit intensity in perfect tandem. The finish is medium in length and currently fruit-driven, though the earthy elements underneath suggest further evolution and maturation to benefit. Drink after 2024.                      Lauren Buzzeo

Name: Tamar Ridge 2018 Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Leather, dried strawberry and peppercorn lead into a nose loaded with chaparral spice of light thyme and sage on this vineyard designate. It's a bit shy on the palate at first, and then light cranberry and raspberry flavors emerge against the crushed stone and light red-flower flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 Will's Cabin Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling explodes with aroma on the nose, delivering scents of thyme and bay leaf as well as plump raspberry and alpine strawberry. That wild forest element is redolent on the palate, where more bay, sagebrush and fennel flavors meet with black raspberry and, on the finish, a hint of damp soil.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Assiduous 2019 Lilo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Chalone, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight aromas of boysenberry and black raspberry meet with a wet soil minerality, red flowers and a touch of mace on the nose of this bottling. Tart cherry and cranberry flavors are fresh on the palate, where mixed dried herbs and a light vanilla finish make for a complex experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chalone Vineyard 2019 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Chalone)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Stemmy, bright and earthy, this is a high-toned and citrus-driven red from the cool-climate appellation and site. Mineral-like crushed rock adds to the texture and length of the wine, accentuated by well-integrated tannin and oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacRostie 2018 Rodgers Creek Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Upper Hemel en Aarde Valley, South Africa
Description: A pronounced earthy, cocoa nib character wafts from the glass, while further nosing unveils layers of ripe cherry, boysenberry and plum flesh. The palate is smooth and supple in feel, with juicy, concentrated red fruit flavors that partner with vibrant acidity to yield a bright, mouthwatering finish that transitions into flavors of cocoa-dusted cherry skin, forest floor and tree bark on the back.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Storm 2018 Ignis Pinot Noir (Upper Hemel en Aarde Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep, dark and sharp aromas of black raspberry and crumpled lavender are coated in a slate-like minerality on the nose of this appellation blend. The purple -lower focus is pure and intense on the palate, where a bright acidity opens toward cinnamon and vanilla on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stephen Ross 2018 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Valley, South Africa
Description: Pronounced black and rooibos tea characteristics drive the nose of this earthy, herbal wine, with supporting tones of dried red cherry and raspberry as a fruity accompaniment. It's medium in feel, like crushed silk, with fine yet supportive tannins that lend pleasant grip to the palate and carry through to the earthy, tea-centric finish that brings you back to that first sniff. It's a lovely, complex package.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Storm 2016 Vrede Pinot Noir (Hemel-en-Aarde Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plush and rich aromas of black cherry, cola cream and light vanilla are offset by a brisk black-plum freshness on the very inviting nose of this bottling. Cola, root beer and even Dr Pepper spices blossom on the palate, lifting the cherry-cordial core while riding strong acidity into a slightly sanguine finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alma Rosa 2018 El Jabali Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, complex and savory wine offers a wonderful blend of herb, black-cherry, forest-floor and black-tea aromas that are nicely echoed in the flavors. The mouthfeel is full but nicely buoyed by acidity and light tannins, giving a snappy texture followed by a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bee Hunter 2016 Oppenlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mt. Harlan, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked cherry, star anise, clove and chai elements show on the ripe and spicy nose of this bottling, which was harvested after this vintage's huge Labor Day heat spike. The wine is rich, heavy and layered on the palate, with black plum flavors coated in cardamom and sagebrush.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Calera 2017 Ryan Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, complex and savory wine offers a wonderful blend of herb, black-cherry, forest-floor and black-tea aromas that are nicely echoed in the flavors. The mouthfeel is full but nicely buoyed by acidity and light tannins, giving a snappy texture followed by a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bee Hunter 2016 Oppenlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mt. Harlan, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked cherry, star anise, clove and chai elements show on the ripe and spicy nose of this bottling, which was harvested after this vintage's huge Labor Day heat spike. The wine is rich, heavy and layered on the palate, with black plum flavors coated in cardamom and sagebrush.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Calera 2017 Ryan Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)

Appellation: Tasmania, Tasmania, Australia
Description: This small-batch label is from Paul and Gilli Lipscombe, who have been instrumental in putting Tasmania's Huon Valley on the map. A vibrant, translucent cherry hue, this is an ethereal Pinot that pulses with energy; smashable (as the Aussies say) and serious all at once. The nose is delicately aromatic, reeling you in gently. Notes of wild blueberry and strawberry, dried flowers and a whiff of baking spice and an olive grove at harvest float from the glass. The palate crackles with acidity, bouncy bright fruit and spice, and a cocktail bitters-like bite at the finish. A buzzy wine with heart and soul.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Sailor Seeks Horse 2018 Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling bursts forth on the nose with aromas of pomegranate, cherry, bay leaf and pine. The palate is also brisk and loaded with red fruits such as cherry, raspberry and pomegranate, yet it's the light smoke and forest herbs that set it apart.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lester 2017 Domingo Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick in concentrated red-fruit ripeness and a taste of caramel, this coastal wine retains plenty of powerful tannin and oak. Made in an abundant style, it lingers in forest, baking spice and a taste of black tea, finishing with a waxy, velvety texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Crescere 2017 Proprietary Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Delicate and rose petaled, this soft, supple red wine is light in strawberry and cherry flavor. It takes on a more robust weight and mouthfeel on the midpalate, building to a spicy, acid-driven finish marked by lovely, lingering notes of chocolate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Davies 2018 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crumpled red flowers, tart cherry, raspberry, bay leaf and mint converge in a mellow, delicate manner on the nose of this bottling. Crisp cranberry and pomegranate make for a brisk fruit experience on the palate, yet there are savory mushroom elements as well, all wrapped in a firm texture. Drink 2022–2037.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 La Vida Bella Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hearty aromas of black raspberry and muddled plum are lifted by sage and pepper on the ripe but clean nose of this bottling. There's a pleasantly herbal kick to the palate, where the sagebrush aspects wrap around the dark-mulberry and wild-plum flavors. Rocky tannins give both structure and minerality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tolosa 2018 Heritage Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick in concentrated red-fruit ripeness and a taste of caramel, this coastal wine retains plenty of powerful tannin and oak. Made in an abundant style, it lingers in forest, baking spice and a taste of black tea, finishing with a waxy, velvety texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Crescere 2017 Proprietary Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Delicate and rose petaled, this soft, supple red wine is light in strawberry and cherry flavor. It takes on a more robust weight and mouthfeel on the midpalate, building to a spicy, acid-driven finish marked by lovely, lingering notes of chocolate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Davies 2018 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a monstrously structured, powerful and generous wine from the appellation. Thick waves of black cherry and strawberry present as velvety smooth on the palate, accented in black tea, cardamom and a wash of toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donum 2018 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Tasmania, Tasmania, Australia
Description: This small-batch label is from Paul and Gilli Lipscombe, who have been instrumental in putting Tasmania's Huon Valley on the map. A vibrant, translucent cherry hue, this is an ethereal Pinot that pulses with energy; smashable (as the Aussies say) and serious all at once. The nose is delicately aromatic, reeling you in gently. Notes of wild blueberry and strawberry, dried flowers and a whiff of baking spice and an olive grove at harvest float from the glass. The palate crackles with acidity, bouncy bright fruit and spice, and a cocktail bitters-like bite at the finish. A buzzy wine with heart and soul.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Sailor Seeks Horse 2018 Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried cherries, strawberry, spice cake and a touch of leathery funk show on the nose of this bottling. Tart cranberry and cherry-compote flavors meet with orange rind and cinnamon on the sip, which is lightly bodied, complex and well structured.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Foley 2018 JA Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Very ripe, lush perfumed fruit flavors and a rounded, luxurious texture bring a lot of pleasure to this full-bodied wine. Subtle accents of cinnamon and nutmeg shade the tasty black- and red-cherry flavors while mild tannins give just enough grip in the mouth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Handley 2017 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Humboldt County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This sleek and complex wine is relatively light in body and offers complex scents of tea, cherries and cedar followed by tangy red-cherry and cinnamon flavors. Light tannins are nicely interwoven with good acidity for excellent balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Joseph Jewell 2018 Fruitland Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)

Appellation: Walker Bay, South Africa
Description: There's a lovely vibrancy to the nose of this light and ethereal red, with scents of tart cherry, raspberry and currant alongside accents of clove-spiked orange, rooibos and spiced rose water. The palate is light and silky in feel, with pronounced acidity and a tart-fruit character that carries through to the bright yet lingering finish.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Creation 2018 The Art of Pinot Noir (Walker Bay)

Appellation: Mt. Harlan, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from a vineyard planted in 1975, which doesn't even produce a ton per acre, begins with brisk aromas of pomegranate before the richer tones of game, earth and oak emerge. Baked currant and cranberry flavors meet with crisp red plum on the palate, which is full of the estate's telltale mountain spices.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Calera 2017 Selleck Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe red-currant and cranberry aromas become more complex when roasted cherry tomato and dried herb elements converge on the nose of this bottling. Snappy raspberry flavors zip on the sip, backed by orange peel, making for an altogether mellow expression.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 Razorback Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Subtle aromas of mint and cherries lead to good, ripe black-cherry, bay leaf and forest-floor nuances on the palate of this pure-tasting, well-balanced wine. Nice depth and delicious layering make it memorable.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2019 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This indulgent, ripe and mouthcoating wine overflows with tempting black-cherry and plum flavors wrapped in a soft, full texture and little noticeable tannin. It's a relaxed, generous wine that's ready to enjoy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Foursight 2018 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There are tart and tangy aromas of red plum and sour cherry on the nose of this bottling, which also recalls incense and cedar, reminiscent of a brawny men's cologne. Crisp cranberry-fruit flavors are decorated with pine needle, eucalyptus tea and lightly cracked pepper on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: GoGi 2017 Erinn Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Perry Ranch was part of what was formerly known as Keefer Ranch and is farmed by the Dutton family. Light flecks of black tea and forest floor highlight a nuanced body of soft, supple tannin and texture, giving it a fresh plushness that appeals. Lively flavors of cranberry, orange and strawberry contribute balanced richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Davies 2018 Perry Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Tasmania, Tasmania, Australia
Description: This distinctly Tassie Pinot offers a bouncy red cherry tone in the fore backed by hints of cinnamon and earthy spice. The palate is medium in weight, lifted by tart cranberry fruit and crunchy acidity. Silky tannins allow the fruit to shine brightly through the gaps.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Devil's Corner 2019 Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hearty aromas of boysenberry, singed meat, rosemary and cardamom make for a heady nose on this appellation blend. The palate is driven by spice and herb, showing nutmeg, rosemary and pine needle, alongside the dark-plum core of fruit.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Barden 2018 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There are tart and tangy aromas of red plum and sour cherry on the nose of this bottling, which also recalls incense and cedar, reminiscent of a brawny men's cologne. Crisp cranberry-fruit flavors are decorated with pine needle, eucalyptus tea and lightly cracked pepper on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: GoGi 2017 Erinn Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a classic, well-balanced and delicious wine that doesn't go over the top with ripeness or oakiness. Pure cherry and strawberry flavors ride a smooth, lightly gripping texture that keeps begging for another sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2019 Méthode a L'Ancienne Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a cool-climate site planted to high-density vines, this wine is immensely funky and earthy in all the right ways. Crunchy citrus meets lifted acidity and prominent tannins, offering contrast to the flavors of bay leaf, mint and blackberry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Marimar 2017 Mas Cavalls Doña Margarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy in blood orange and strawberry, this Sebastopol Hills-grown wine shows the coolness of the climate in swirls of black tea and cardamom. Earthy and savory throughout, it finishes in a densely rich note of fig.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Alquimista Cellars 2016 Mes Filles Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This elegant, tasty, medium-bodied wine offers a flinty but jammy aroma, a light, smooth texture and plenty of plump cherry and strawberry flavors. It shows a good, appetizing balance and persistent, layered fruit and baking spices.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bravium 2018 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap-Marin County, North Coast, California, US
Description: Big, broad cherry flavors are lifted by lively acidity and moderate tannins in this full-bodied wine that sports good sour cherry and raspberry tones as well as light black-pepper and cinnamon nuances.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kendric 2018 Proprietor Grown Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap-Marin County)

Appellation: Upper Hemel en Aarde Valley, South Africa
Description: Aromas of forest floor, dried hibiscus, macerated strawberry and cherry form the nose of this attractive Pinot, with delicate baking spice accents lingering in the back. It's light and satiny in feel, with pronounced acidity that lifts the earthy red fruit flavors and carries them through with mouthwatering drive to the lingering close. It's easy to enjoy now, but should hold well through 2026.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Storm 2016 Ignis Pinot Noir (Upper Hemel en Aarde Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has a spicy intensity of nutmeg, cardamom and cola, accents that soften and complicate the thick concentration of wild strawberry and blueberry jam. Medium bodied, it holds its weight and richness in check, making room for underlying acidity to freshen and lengthen the experience.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Calling 2018 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rugged aromas of sagebrush, baked earth and leather give depth to the roasted cranberry core of this wine. Rich and hearty flavors of seared strawberry and muddled mulberry come through on the sip, where a creamy texture leads into gamy hints of blistered pork skin toward the vanilla-kissed finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Two Sisters 2017 Lindsay's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Leyda Valley, Chile
Description: A wide and generous nose dances between earthy ripeness and spiced plum, while this coastal Pinot offers excellent flow and balance. Flavors of black cherry, spiced plum and supportive oak work well together, while the finish is smooth and elegant. As Chilean Pinot Noirs go, this is hitting all the right chords. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Leyda 2018 Single Vineyard Las Brisas Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: A beguiling bouquet of fruit and flowers, this estate wine has an equally savory edge of forest floor, black tea and rose petal to offer. Medium bodied and silky in texture, it tastes fresh and lively in pomegranate and wild strawberry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Artesa 2018 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge, South Africa
Description: Lovely cocoa and sweet-spice characteristics ride atop a nose of ripe red raspberry, cherry and wild strawberry. It smells plush and seductive on first pass, but the palate offers a refined sip of harmonious just-ripe fruit, ample acidity and superfine yet subtly structuring tannins. It all fits together in wonderful harmony and is ready to be enjoyed now, though it should continue to drink well through 2025.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Ataraxia 2016 Pinot Noir (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very exuberant aromas of freshly smashed black raspberry, sumac, wild strawberry and star anise pop on the nose of this bottling. Tart cherries and toasted sage meet with opulent strawberry cream on the palate, which is quite complex and layered in herb and fruit flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Flying Goat Cellars 2017 Dierberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoothed out aromas of red cherry, mesquite and star anise make for a suave and well-integrated entry to the nose of this bottling. There is ample oak on the sip, which frames the silky texture and creamy cherry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Foley 2018 Bar Lazy S Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Abundant, delicious red- and black-cherry flavors drive this medium- to full-bodied wine in terms of both aroma and flavor. It weaves in black tea, cloves and a touch of cinnamon on the palate, which is generous and plush in texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Foursight 2018 Paraboll Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Alluring, well-developed aromas and rich, layered flavors help this full-bodied wine stand out from the crowd. It layers dark cherry and forest floor aromas and spiced plum and rosemary flavors on a broad and mouthfilling texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wentworth 2019 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy, tangy and savory in cedar, black tea and rhubarb, this is an expressive, exuberant red wine that is earthy and lightly spicy. Firm tannins provide a structural foundation beneath light-bodied ripeness and persistent acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Saintsbury 2018 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick and densely layered in rhubarb, forested notes and savory black tea, this well-tended site contributes plenty of cool-climate intensity and complexity, sitting just west of Sebastopol near the tiny town of Graton. Earthy vibrancy defines its breadth of moderate ripeness and graceful nature.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Saintsbury 2018 Pratt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Muddled black-plum-paste, tart cranberry, mace and vanilla aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend, which comes mostly, perhaps entirely, from estate fruit. The dark-plum and mulberry flavors of the palate are lifted by bay leaf, light thyme and dried sage, and set against a chiseled stone structure.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sanford 2018 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Light and stemmy, with enduring earthiness, this vineyard-designate from the cool-climate appellation shows rose petal and pomegranate notes built around refined tannins and integrated oak. It builds flavor and body on the midpalate, with nuanced black cherry and strawberry seasoned in cardamom.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bruliam 2018 Sangiacomo Roberts Road Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Raspberry jam, tangy black plum, pine needle and creamy masala spice show on the engaging nose of this bottling. It's plush on the palate, combining ripe berry and plum with dewy sage and tomato-leaf flavors, leading into a strongly thyme-flavored finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Foley 2018 T Anchor Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Valley, South Africa
Description: There's a spicy character to the nose of this robust red, with notes of clove and whole peppercorn riding atop the crunchy cranberry, rhubarb and currant fruit profile. The palate is tense and sprightly in feel, with more of the same bright red fruit flavors, ample acidity and a moderate tannic structure that suggests this would benefit from some time to further mature and harmonize. The medium-length finish offers plenty of tannic grip and fruit-skin flavors. Enjoy through 2028.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Hamilton Russell 2018 Pinot Noir (Hemel-en-Aarde Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Full-bodied aromas of blackberry and black raspberry pick up nutmeg and mace spice on the rich nose of this bottling. It's fairly big-boned and ripe on the palate too, where plum-sauce and cranberry-compote elements meet with orange-rind flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ken Brown 2017 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This substantial, medium-bodied wine combines aromas of flint, red cherries and rhubarb with a lightly tannic texture and vivid black-tea and sour cherry flavors that are focused and concentrated. Not a huge wine, but it's a trim, sleek and appetizing one.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Winery SF 2018 Pinot Noir (North Coast)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Valley, South Africa
Description: There's a spicy character to the nose of this robust red, with notes of clove and whole peppercorn riding atop the crunchy cranberry, rhubarb and currant fruit profile. The palate is tense and sprightly in feel, with more of the same bright red fruit flavors, ample acidity and a moderate tannic structure that suggests this would benefit from some time to further mature and harmonize. The medium-length finish offers plenty of tannic grip and fruit-skin flavors. Enjoy through 2028.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Hamilton Russell 2018 Pinot Noir (Hemel-en-Aarde Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Full-bodied aromas of blackberry and black raspberry pick up nutmeg and mace spice on the rich nose of this bottling. It's fairly big-boned and ripe on the palate too, where plum-sauce and cranberry-compote elements meet with orange-rind flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ken Brown 2017 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light in color, this appellation blend of Fiddlestix, John Sebastiano and Peake Ranch vineyards begins with warm aromas of French toast, light strawberry, a touch of fig and plenty of Christmas spice. There is a strong sagebrush tone to the palate, full of wild thyme and peppery spice flavors that are set against a crisp backdrop of wild berry and red currant.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Westerly 2018 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Tasmania, Tasmania, Australia
Description: From Tasmania's east coast, this is a structured Pinot that needs air to blow off some funky, meaty reductive notes. When it does open, it offers a nose of blueberries and cherries, wintery spices and herbs, river stones and a streak of barrel influence. The palate is wound tightly by rather austere tannins, but there's a lovely purity of fruit and spice that makes this drinkable now with fatty protein, or capable of aging until 2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Devil's Corner 2018 Resolution Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy and broad in appeal with a generous helping of baked cherry and strawberry, this coastal wine is also earthy and savory in rhubarb and black tea. Lengthy, bold and balanced, it has well-integrated oak and tannin, finishing in a taste of black tea and forest floor.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flowers 2019 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hearty and heavy aromas of black-cherry juice, sarsaparilla and cola make for an invitingly rich and spicy nose on this vineyard selection. Those prominent spices carry onto the sip, where roasted cherry tomato and blistered black-plum flavors make for a slightly tart balance against the powerful spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Flying Goat Cellars 2017 2A Rio Vista Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hearty and heavy aromas of black-cherry juice, sarsaparilla and cola make for an invitingly rich and spicy nose on this vineyard selection. Those prominent spices carry onto the sip, where roasted cherry tomato and blistered black-plum flavors make for a slightly tart balance against the powerful spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Flying Goat Cellars 2017 2A Rio Vista Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine made with native yeast and zero new oak offers a rich blend of savory and black-fruit flavors on a broad, palate-soothing texture. Hints of balsam and sage add interest to the subtle black-cherry and clove notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Foursight 2018 Charles Vineyard Zero Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Tasmania, Tasmania, Australia
Description: From Tasmania's east coast, this is a structured Pinot that needs air to blow off some funky, meaty reductive notes. When it does open, it offers a nose of blueberries and cherries, wintery spices and herbs, river stones and a streak of barrel influence. The palate is wound tightly by rather austere tannins, but there's a lovely purity of fruit and spice that makes this drinkable now with fatty protein, or capable of aging until 2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Devil's Corner 2018 Resolution Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This countywide blend begins with wet slate, dried herb, cinnamon spice and tart cherry aromas on the nose. There is a riper thickness to the palate, where black-tea, mace, dried lavender and boysenberry flavors align.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stephen Ross 2018 Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light in the glass, this bottling shows rugged aromas of muddled mulberry and wild plum as well as sagebrush, tangy blistered tomato and peppercorn. Cranberry skin tartness leads the palate, where wild thyme and sagebrush elements add complexity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Flying Goat Cellars 2017 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Gamy aromas of dried mulberry, bloody meats, concentrated rose and leathery charcuterie show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is savory as well, showing dried plum and berry, wood spice and more leather, all wrapped in a pithy texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lester 2017 Mercurio Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried plum and strawberry meet with turned earth, crumpled red flowers and a hint of ginger spice on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is cohesive in structure and flavor, combining creamy cherry and cola-spice elements with earthier tree bark and licorice seasonings.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2019 Bentrock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a lot of barrel spice on the nose of this bottling, including mace and star anise, which lift up the rich boysenberry-pie and smoke tones. It's quite rich on the palate, full of more boysenberry and charred oak flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ken Brown 2016 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
