Description: Thick tannins lead to a savory, stemmy edginess of varietal intensity in this medium-bodied wine, showing dense layers of black cherry, strawberry and tea. Medium bodied, it settles on the midpalate to offer silky texture and a length of cardamom.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Artesa 2018 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tasting of strawberry cream, this is a lively and fresh wine with cool-climate acidity that keeps it vibrant in contrast to the underlying richness of ripe fruit. Melon, cherry and raspberry fill out a fleshy midpalate that is lightly spiced in nutmeg and rose.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Castello di Amorosa 2019 Cresta D'Oro Vineyard Rosato Di Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This small-production wine is delicately layered in red cherry, strawberry and a hint of vanilla. Subdued in style and approach, it shows an underlying earthiness marked by stem and bark tones that accentuate the oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fulcrum 2018 Hogan's Run Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of black plum, boysenberry and violet are strong on the nose of this bottling. The palate's flavors are also booming and bold, full of ripe dark berries, with a layer of underlying baking spice to cut the heaviness.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Landmark 2018 Dierberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tasting of strawberry cream, this is a lively and fresh wine with cool-climate acidity that keeps it vibrant in contrast to the underlying richness of ripe fruit. Melon, cherry and raspberry fill out a fleshy midpalate that is lightly spiced in nutmeg and rose.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Castello di Amorosa 2019 Cresta D'Oro Vineyard Rosato Di Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cherry-cordial aromas gain complexity with dried rose, hibiscus, turned earth and cinnamon-roll touches on the nose of this appellation blend. There is a leathery, dried plum flavor to the sip, where an underlying zip of acidity lifts the dark fruit and sticky tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick in flavors of cola and leather, this wine shows a stemmy earthiness of savory character, built around ripe, ribald and abundant fruit and powerful concentration.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Walt 2018 Brown Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly ripe while tart aromas of sour cherry meet with star anise, licorice and a bit of mushroom on the nose of this bottling. There's a touch of leather to the palate, where shiitake and tea-leaf flavors lead through dried herbs to a caramelized finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Steele 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge, South Africa
Description: Just ripe red cherry and raspberry flavors waft from the glass of this vibrant pour, while a touch of cola spice adds depth in the background. The palate is light and fruit-forward, with pronounced acidity that yields a lively, refreshing sip that remains clean and bright through the medium-length close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Tesselaarsdal 2019 Pinot Noir (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

Appellation: Chalone, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hearty aromas of black plum meet with turned earth on the nose of this bottling. Oak-kissed hints of vanilla show on the sip, where bold black-plum and blackberry flavors are both rich and slightly tangy.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chalone Vineyard 2018 Pinot Noir (Chalone)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a sultry, brooding red wine, exuberant in black cherry, black tea, forest floor and rose petal. With a supple backbone of integrated tannin and toasted oak, it reaches a velvety finish of cola that accentuates its full-bodied style and enduring richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Landmark 2018 Hop Kiln Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy, leathery and intense, this wine is made from a single clone and is grippy, powerful and structured. The fruit is a mix of raspberry, black cherry and wild strawberry, with additional elements of black tea and cola.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cuvaison 2018 Mariafeld Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a site originally planted in 1870, this red tastes of baked fruit compote and offers aromatic notes of rose petal. Black tea, bark and forest floor provide a savory contrast to the thick and concentrated richness and boldness of cardamom.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Saintsbury 2018 Stanly Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge, South Africa
Description: This opens with direct fruit aromas of wild strawberry, cherry and a touch of snappy currant, hit by glimmers of crushed rose petals and dried fynbos. The palate is well-balanced and medium in body, although ample acidity keeps the fruit in check and lends verve to carry it all through to the long, mouthwatering finish.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Tesselaarsdal 2018 Pinot Noir (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

Appellation: Malibu Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-cherry liqueur, slight incense and tangy plum-skin aromas show on the nose of this bottling made from Malibu by Bruno D'Alfonso and Kris Curran. Toasted oak and cedar show on the sip, with cherry compote, orange rind and a hint of vanilla rising into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: The Malibu Vineyard 2013 Rambla Pacifico Pinot Noir (Malibu Coast)

Appellation: Western Cape, South Africa
Description: There's a pretty, lifted mentholated herb and fynbos top note to the nose of this wine, with underlying characteristics of crisp cherry and red currant. The palate is bright and well-balanced, with ample red fruit flavors that are partnered with bright acidity and fine yet structuring tannins. This should continue to evolve well over the medium term. Drink after 2023.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Thorne & Daughters 2018 Copper Pot Pinot Noir (Western Cape)

Appellation: Orange, New South Wales, Australia
Description: This is an easygoing and affordable example of modern, cool climate Aussie Pinot. Ripe red berries bounce from the glass, followed by quieter aromas of florals, baking spice and a slight mushroomy savoriness. The palate is light to medium in weight, fleshy and round, but with a tug of savory tannins holding it all together. Knock back slightly chilled, with or without food.                      Christina Pickard
Name: See Saw 2019 Pinot Noir (Orange)

Appellation: Aconcagua Costa, Chile
Description: Briary plum and red berry aromas come with side notes of tea, wood spice, savory herbs and iron. On the palate, this is a touch thick and resiny, but healthy acidity cuts through the wine's natural ripeness. Spiced plum flavors are a touch oaky, while this is dry and firmly tannic on a finish where complex notes of salt, tomato and black tea surface.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Montes 2018 Alpha Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Costa)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rose-petal and orange-bergamot aromas dominate on the entry of this wine from the famous site—a moderately ripe, perfumed and velvety expression of the variety. Lusher elements of toasted oak, cola and vanilla come into play on the lengthy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fulcrum 2018 Gap's Crown Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a light nose and thick tannin, this medium-bodied wine is sultry in blue and red fruit, the nose marked by rose-petal aromas. Tobacco, black-tea and forest -loor notes embody a savory contrast to the juiciness of the fruit, finishing gracefully in silky tannin.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Saintsbury 2018 Lee Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this appellation blend pops with ripe, juicy cherries, vanilla and a hint of cinnamon on the nose. It's playful if simple on the palate, with fresh and clean flavors of cherry sorbet, fennel pollen and plucked thyme.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lightpost 2019 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wild aromas of bramble and cranberry meet with damp pine and tangy plum on the nose of this bottling. Dewy sagebrush, green-peppercorn and eucalyptus-leaf flavors lead the palate, alongside tart raspberry and cranberry.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cutruzzola 2017 Giacomino Reserve Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Light and delicate in layers of strawberry and blood orange, this well-made wine is wrapped in silky tannins. Fresh, crisp acidity boosts the earthiness and lasting notes of baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cuvaison 2018 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: An oak-driven entry leads to a broad core of fleshy red-cherry and strawberry richness, the wine complemented in a backbone of forest floor and black tea. Balanced and bold, it packs a punch midway on the palate before softening on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fulcrum 2018 Wildcat Mountain Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Unusually heavy on the black-fruit flavors and quite smoky-toasty in aroma at first, this full-bodied wine offers superripe plum, black-pepper, chocolate and graphite flavors. It's heavily extracted, robust and moderately tannic.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Walt 2018 Savoy Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a tangy plum-skin tartness to the nose of this bottling, with a touch of dried sagebrush spice. Dewy herbs also show on the palate, where the tart plum fruits dominate the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cutruzzola 2017 Gloria Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Shy aromas of black plum, tea leaf, coffee bean and loamy black soil show on the nose of this bottling. Sandy tannins frame the sip, which shows tarry and woolly flavors as the dark boysenberry fruit arises atop persistent acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lightpost 2019 Jack Ranch Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This nicely tangy wine blends red-cherry, raspberry and mild toasted oak flavors for a tasty but lean profile and good balance. Medium body and light tannins give it an inviting snap in the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Aquinas 2018 Pinot Noir (North Coast)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: This Yarra Valley Pinot is aging quickly. A dusty brick hue, the nose shows some volatility, but there's also a good deal more: notes of cherry cordial, crushed dried rose petals—some on their stems—and soft cinnamon bark and clove spice. There's a good lick of oak, too, which is more prominent on the palate. Granular tannins, still-fresh acidity and cherry-and-rose characters dominate. The finish is a little bitter. Drink now.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Levantine Hill 2016 Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This hearty, robust wine is an outstanding value. It leads with light woodsmoke and black-pepper aromas over fairly concentrated and appealing black-cherry and plum flavors supported by light tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Crusher 2018 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Tasmania, Tasmania, Australia
Description: There's a lot of sweet, fruity oak on this Pinot for this reviewer's taste. It covers up the lovely berry fruit, vanilla and savory spice character of the site and grapes. A medium- to full-bodied sip, the fruit and oak sit heavily together in the mouth. That said, tannins are nicely structured and textured, hinting that this Pinot could hold up decently with time in the bottle. For now, though, it doesn't do Tassie's unique terroirs and elegant fruit justice.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Handpicked 2017 Collection Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

Appellation: Western Cape, South Africa
Description: The nose of this red leans a touch medicinal, with mentholated red cherry, licorice and bramble tones. It's medium in weight and like crushed velvet in feel, with ripe red fruit flavors that are supported by medium-grain tannins and ample acidity. Give this a little more time to round out. Try after 2022.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Kara-Tara 2018 Pinot Noir (Western Cape)

Appellation: Walker Bay, South Africa
Description: Notes of sweet-spiced cherry pie, mocha and delicate violet dance in the glass of this enticing Pinot. The palate is light in body, yet robust in feel, with flavors that mirror the bouquet and delicate tannins that lend a soft, pleasant structure to the sip.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Creation 2019 Reserve Pinot Noir (Walker Bay)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Church incense and cherry vanilla cola form the nose of this medium-bodied red, with a touch of pie crust and baking spice weaved into the background. It's smooth and plush on the palate, with a delicate juiciness to the otherwise ripe and robust fruit tones followed by a pleasantly clean finish.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Edgebaston 2018 David Finlayson Camino Africana Pinot Noir (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: Cherry and candied berry aromas form the opening, while this everyday Pinot from a hot year displays rubbery tannins on an otherwise sound palate. Cassis and plum flavors finish with commendable freshness, with hints of natural spice as well as oak spice.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Casablanca 2020 Céfiro Cool Reserve Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Church incense and cherry vanilla cola form the nose of this medium-bodied red, with a touch of pie crust and baking spice weaved into the background. It's smooth and plush on the palate, with a delicate juiciness to the otherwise ripe and robust fruit tones followed by a pleasantly clean finish.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Edgebaston 2018 David Finlayson Camino Africana Pinot Noir (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Immensely earthy in turned earth and tea, this wine is intensely full bodied and thick on the palate, with dense layers of strawberry and rose. The vineyard is certified both organic and biodynamic.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Davies 2018 Three Amigos Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Subtle on the nose, this rosé from the Edna Valley Vineyard shows aromas of rust, dried berry and chalk. There are faint earth tones to the palate, giving some balance to the dried strawberry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lightpost 2019 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-cherry and cola aromas are clean and focused, with a hint of turned soil providing minerality on the nose of this bottling. Deep dark-cherry flavors are spice by vanilla and nutmeg on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hahn 2019 Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Cauquenes Valley, Chile
Description: Jumpy red fruit aromas suggest hot rocks and iron. A fresh, lean palate is agile, while raspberry, currant and herbal green flavors reflect the wine's cool coastal origins. Zesty acidity and red fruit leftovers drive a lean finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valdivieso 2018 Single Vineyard Piedra Hermosa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Cauquenes Valley)

Appellation: Hawke's Bay, New Zealand
Description: This is an austere Pinot that initially shows a funky, burned rubber quality on the nose. But with vigorous swirling in the glass or time in a decanter this blows off, revealing a sappy, spicy wine with a good lick of toasty oak influence. There are notes of fresh red currant and cranberry, warm tar, graphite, sap and a medicinal herbal nuance. Tannins in the mouth are sappy and somewhat astringent and oak-driven, dominating a wine that needs at least another few years before optimal drinking time. Drink 2023–2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Te Mata 2018 Estate Vineyards Pinot Noir (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light caramel and star anise aromas meet with dried cranberry, baked cherry and plum on the nose of this bottling. The palate lacks a touch of texture, but delivers fine flavors of dried cherry, oregano and leathery game.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brophy Clark 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a good, ripe-tasting and full-bodied wine that offers plenty of plums, light oak spices like cinnamon and vanilla and a moderately tannic texture. It's broad and supple on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: B Side 2018 Pinot Noir (North Coast)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is nicely balanced, pleasantly fruity and accented by light smoke and baking-spice notes. Mild tannins and good acidity make the mouth water.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Parducci 2019 Small Lot Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of black-raspberry jelly meet with wet rocks on the nose of this bottling—a partnership between Cosmopolitan magazine and Guarachi Wine Partners. Bold flavors of plum and cherry show on the palate, where a brisk acidity cleans up the ripeness by the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Uncorked by Cosmopolitan 2019 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wild-sage and eucalyptus-leaf aromas meet with tangy black plum on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite tart and tangy in black-plum-skin flavors, made more complex by tea-leaf spices.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wolff 2017 Dijon Clones Selection Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tangy and thick with a burly midpalate of toasted oak and significant tannin, this is powerfully built for the variety, with enduring concentration and a velvety finish. The fruit is jammy and rich, a mix of black cherry and blackberry.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: Deer Camp Vineyard Grace Benoist Ranch
Name: Etude 2017 Deer Camp Vineyard Grace Benoist Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Plump black-cherry and tangy raspberry flavors are accompanied by cinnamon and vanilla aromas in this full-bodied, mouthfilling wine. The ripe fruit flavors nicely fill out a smooth, non-tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Longvale 2019 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Cachapoal Valley, Chile
Description: A blocky nose smells tomatoey, while this Central Valley Pinot Noir from a hot year feels big and full, without much finesse. Dark berry flavors are ripe and fruity but don't really taste like Pinot Noir, while a full, tannic finish confirms that this is more like a Bordeaux variety than textbook PN.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casas del Toqui 2020 Barrel Series Reserva Pinot Noir (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of pomegranate, hibiscus and raspberry are a bit fruit-punchy on the nose of this bottling. Dried cherry and berry flavors come through on the palate with a pinch of oregano and somewhat sticky tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: 7 Cellars 2019 The Farm Collection Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This red blends fruit from both Gap's Crown and Wildcat Mountain vineyards, opening with a confectionery nose of baked cherry, cola and vanilla cookie. The richness oozes from a concentrated midpalate of firm tannin and toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fulcrum 2018 On Point Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hearty aromas of boysenberry meet with raw meat, iron and a touch of oak on the nose of this bottling. The palate is somewhat viscous and oily in texture, carrying sour plum and dried herb flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hess Select 2018 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: An opaque dark color and aromas of latex, plastic and earthy berry fruits announce a full-bodied, fully ripe Pinot Noir that's chunky and stocky on the palate. Black plum and blackberry flavors finish with chewy tannins, making this hard to peg as a cool climate wine.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Loma Larga 2020 Lomas del Valle Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Expressive aromas of black cherry, gingerbread and dark hibiscus are quite ripe and extracted on the nose of this bottling. That extraction shows on the palate too, where dark-cherry and dried carnation flavors show.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McClain Cellars 2018 Love & Happiness Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Franschhoek, South Africa
Description: Carnation, church incense, raspberry and cocoa-dusted cherry form the nose of this richly aromatic red. It's silky and smooth in feel, with robust, fleshy red cherry and red plum flavors that carry through to the soft finish. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Haute Cabrière 2018 Unwooded Franschhoek Pass Pinot Noir (Franschhoek)

Appellation: Leyda Valley, Chile
Description: Tutti-frutti berry aromas are medicinal like cherry cough drops and red licorice sticks. An inexact palate lacks structure, while this tastes of medicinal plum and raspberry prior to a lightweight finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Leyda 2020 Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bit shy on the nose, this bottling offers light plum, wet soil and dried herb aromas. There's a slightly reductive streak of tar and wet earth on the palate, where the light plum flavors also return.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Edna Valley Vineyard 2018 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Oaky aromas dominate the baked cherry and rust elements on the nose of this bottling. Black cherry and cola pop on the palate, where hints of iodine and oak add complexity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dressage 2019 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Smoky, oaky, spicy aromas and flavors stand front and center in this medium-bodied, lightly tannic wine. Subdued black-cherry notes give it reasonable fruitiness, but the emphasis is on char and black pepper.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Leese-Fitch 2018 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Full bodied and moderately tannic, this spicy wine offers up black-pepper and charred oak aromas followed by blackberry and cedar flavors that give it a hearty, beefy effect overall.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Simple Life 2018 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Adelaide Hills, South Australia, Australia
Description: For a so-called Reserve wine, this is a straightforward bottling that lacks much of the vibrancy and elegance of other cool climate Aussie Pinots. The nose is ripe with confected cherry and raspberry fruit and some vanilla and baking spice notes. The mouthfeel is thin, with angular acidity and astringent tannins that give a bitterness to the fruit.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Jacob's Creek 2018 Reserve Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: A quiet nose with mild red plum and currant aromas leads to a palate that lacks concentration and purpose. Cherry and plum flavors are slightly oxidized, thus a soft finish with strawberry and raspberry flavors is limited.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Lafken 2018 Single Vineyard Series Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Leyda Valley, Chile
Description: A light and rusty color along with stripped plum and raw oak aromas open this unfocused Pinot Noir. Creamy oak flavors sit atop candied berry fruit, while this shows a mild oxidative note on a plump finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cigar Box 2020 Old Vine Hand Harvested Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A vague fruitiness and a brown-sugary sweetness give this wine a soft, candied profile.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Carson Scott 2019 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a cool-climate site near Freestone, this is an effusive wine that is tangy, succulent and edgy in style. Nutmeg, clove and black tea wrap around layers of blueberry and black cherry, all built around supple tannins.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Three Sticks 2018 William James Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This estate wine brings together notes of forest, crushed rock and spiced dark cherry, focused by a mineral-driven undertone. It shows understated power and leans graceful in style, built by supple, balanced tannins that enclose it all.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Three Sticks 2018 Durell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The old vines –  Pommard clone, own-rooted, and planted in 1976 – offer a rare peek into Oregon's winemaking past. The subtle layering, depth and detail of this wine are impressive, as is the sheer power of these old vines. Red berries, cherries, nectarines and even a hint of pineapple are evident, with silky tannins and perfectly set acids. Aged in 50% new barrels, it's a gem.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Dion 2018 Old Vines Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Jim Clendenen is the master of ageworthy California Pinot Noir, and this bottling, which blends the Bien Nacido and Le Bon Climat vineyards, will last for ages. Aromas of wild sage, thyme and sarsaparilla meet with deep boysenberry and black raspberry on the nose. The palate moves from sour plum to sagebrush, with savory hints of game. Drink now through 2036.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Au Bon Climat 2016 Knox Alexander Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Alluring black-cherry and cinnamon aromas lead to generous, concentrated, lip-smacking flavors in this superb, full-bodied and well-balanced wine. The depth and focus of the fruit flavors are impressive, riding a rich texture that enhances the lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bee Hunter 2016 Docker Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a remote estate property at 1,600-feet in elevation and typically above the Pacific Ocean fog, this is a chewy, wild and complex wine, structured in firm, elongated tannins. Forest-floor, black-tea and cranberry notes define its midpalate core of grip and understated power.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Three Sticks 2018 Walala Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Trento, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Radiant, polished and utterly -delicious, this divine sparkler hits all the right buttons. Made entirely with Pinot Nero, it has delicate but alluring aromas of white stone fruit, wild berry, yellow spring flower and brioche. The dry, creamy palate is chock full of finesse, delivering delicate layers of white peach, pomegranate, apple and bread crust alongside a silky perlage. Bright acidity keeps it balanced.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferrari 2012 Perlé Nero Extra Brut Riserva Pinot Nero (Trento)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Great balance, pure fruit flavors and a brilliant mouthfeel make this elegant wine a real stand-out. Tangy acidity and fine-grained tannins support vivid red-cherry, cranberry and cinnamon flavors, making it a great choice for those who like their oak in moderation. Best through at least 2027.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Phillips Hill 2018 Roma's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The inaugural vintage is named for both the owner's daughter, and also a Sebastopol-situated site. This red is gorgeously aromatic in rose and orange peel. Soft and delicate, it is lengthy and fresh in strawberry, black tea, forest floor and clove. It is balanced and beautifully complex.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Three Sticks 2018 Cuvée Alana Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: McMinnville, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This captures the expressive minerality of Robert and Ellen Brittan's vineyard, with pinpoint details of bright, focused raspberry fruit and tongue-drying rock. It's dense and focused, young and tightly wound, with the structure and acid to age for a considerably long time. Drink 2022 to 2032.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ayoub 2018 Brittan Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Done in a modern style that keeps alcohol in check and doesn't shy away from well-managed phenolics, this brings blackberry and black cherry fruit into focus. Highlights include black olive, anise and espresso. There's a drying minerality—not too much—and excellent length.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bluebird Hill 2018 South Block Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the estate's original 1990 plantings, this sadly marks the final vintage for these phylloxera-affected vines, which have now been removed and replanted. It's a sweet farewell, dense and aromatic with plum and black cherry fruit. The seashell highlights characteristic of the AVA can be sniffed out, along with a substrate of lightly bitter herb. This lovely wine should bring pleasure for many years to come.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brick House 2018 Cuvée du Tonnelier Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the estate's original 1990 plantings, this sadly marks the final vintage for these phylloxera-affected vines, which have now been removed and replanted. It's a sweet farewell, dense and aromatic with plum and black cherry fruit. The seashell highlights characteristic of the AVA can be sniffed out, along with a substrate of lightly bitter herb. This lovely wine should bring pleasure for many years to come.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brick House 2018 Cuvée du Tonnelier Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is smooth and rich, already drinking well and likely to hold well for up to a decade. The flavors coat the palate with lush cherry fruit and accents of cherry cola and sassafras. All Wadenswil clone, half whole cluster fermented, and aged over a year in 30% new French oak, this doesn't have the smoky darkness of the companion release (Claudia's Choice); instead showing the barrel influence with coconut flakes and light baking spices.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Broadley 2018 Jessica Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The five single vineyard selections from Eyrie are partially determined by elevation, Daphne being the highest, topping out at 860 feet. All Pommard clones between 45 and 35 years of age, it was fermented with wild yeast and aged in 12% new barrels. Tart and elegant, the basic framing of fruit and acid and tannin is perfect, the raspberry core bright and lingering as it leads into a long finish touching on cherry. It's an elegant wine from start to finish, which should drink nicely into the mid-2030s.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2017 Daphne Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Ahr, Germany
Description: An exhilarating mineral crush extends from nose to palate, lending freshness to profoundly ripe flavors of black plum and currant. Full-bodied yet spry and lifted, it's a piercing, deeply concentrated Pinot Noir edged by hints of earth, smoke and violet florals. The finish is long and ruffled by fine, furry tannins. Welcoming in youth but structured enough to improve through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Meyer-Näkel 2018 Pinot Noir (Ahr)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted black plum, cinnamon and Christmas-spice aromas show on the nose of this bottling from one of the appellation's westernmost vineyards. There's a rugged gamy and earthy tone to the palate, where bright boysenberry flavors are pumped up with herbs and smoke.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Montemar 2016 Bentrock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Fort Ross-Seaview, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A light, delicate and ultimately fresh red wine from an estate site in the cool-climate appellation, this wine brims in acidity and mineral elements of oyster shell and crushed rock. Strawberry, pomegranate and a bite of tangerine combine with ease across a taut, complex palate of great length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Red Car 2018 Estate Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

Appellation: Fort Ross-Seaview, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A light, delicate and ultimately fresh red wine from an estate site in the cool-climate appellation, this wine brims in acidity and mineral elements of oyster shell and crushed rock. Strawberry, pomegranate and a bite of tangerine combine with ease across a taut, complex palate of great length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Red Car 2018 Estate Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy and shimmering in wild strawberry, pomegranate and orange peel, this is a crisp and persistently fresh red wine, evocative of its cool-climate bona fides. With length and balance, it intrigues in whispers of black tea, cardamom and white pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Red Car 2018 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Oltrepò Pavese, Lombardy, Italy
Description: Red berry, violet and brioche aromas waft out of the glass on this lovely, dry Metodo Classico. Loaded with finesse and flavor, it features juicy strawberry, pomegranate, vanilla and a yeasty hint of bread dough alongside a silky perlage. Bright acidity keeps it remarkably fresh and youthful.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Cigognola 2013 Moratti Rosé Brut Nature Pinot Nero (Oltrepò Pavese)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The first estate wines from this excellent vineyard were made by Drew Voit. This limited bottling is a field blend of seven clones from the original planting 15 years ago. It's wonderfully detailed with subtle, lingering, layered flavors of berries, rock and seashell. Hints of lime and peavine bring further complexity as the wine keeps developing on the palate. A wonderful debut that may be enjoyed immediately or cellared for another half decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lichtenwalter 2018 Joy Block Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This elegant, almost taut, wine is subtle but complex, carrying a combo of bright, crisp red-cherry and cranberry flavors and intricate cinnamon and cedar accents. It's medium-bodied, fresh-tasting and a bit tight with acidity that will help it age well. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Phillips Hill 2018 Day Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A tad hazy in the glass, this four-barrel bottling of the 667 clone begins with aromas of cranberry, pomegranate and raspberry jam, as well as herbal touches of tarragon and pine needle. There's a wild sense to the palate, where black plum, crumpled rose-petal and minty flavors play with tea and slightly bitter herbs into the tart finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Phinch 2019 Chene Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This highlights tart cherry fruit with nuanced notes of tanned leather, cut tobacco, lemon rind and black tea. The flavors combine gracefully and move into soft tannins laced with almond paste and milk chocolate. It's a complex, balanced and tasty wine, made from all Pommard vines from the estate's original 2001 planting.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abbott Claim 2018 Due North Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Muddled black-plum, loamy soil, dried hibiscus and dark mint aromas make for an intense but expertly measured nose for this clonal selection. The palate's texture is polished and feathery, offering broad flavors of black raspberry, light sage oil, rose petal and violet, proving very floral and plush.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bargetto 2019 Mount Eden Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lively floral aromas of lavender and violet meet with crisp black plum and pluot as well as slate and black loam on the nose of this blend of Sanford & Benedict and John Sebastiano vineyards. It's very fresh, lively and zesty on the palate, where black-raspberry flavors are lifted by cola spice and nettle-like herbs.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Paradise Springs 2018 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Inviting black-cherry, rhubarb and rosemary aromas lead to mouthfilling, juicy and vibrant fruit flavors in this nicely balanced, medium- to full-bodied wine. Moderate tannins and tangy acidity keep it lively on the palate and help carry its delicious complexity through a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Phillips Hill 2018 Oppenlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A lovely, bright wine, the fruit flavors focus on cranberry, pomegranate and raspberry. It's stylish and fresh, with snappy, acid-boosted flavors and the structure to age. Drink now for its youthful pizzazz, or cellar it another five or six years to amend the slightly bitter tannins.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bluebird Hill 2018 Mom's Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This slightly yellow-pink bottling, which raises money for books for kids, is one of the better rosés of the vintage, starting with aromas of struck stone, lemon peel and ashy melon. It's very crisp on the palate, with brisk lemon-spray and pink-lime flavors, bound together with immense tension.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: The Great Brain Cell Sacrifice 2019 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A lovely, bright wine, the fruit flavors focus on cranberry, pomegranate and raspberry. It's stylish and fresh, with snappy, acid-boosted flavors and the structure to age. Drink now for its youthful pizzazz, or cellar it another five or six years to amend the slightly bitter tannins.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bluebird Hill 2018 Mom's Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This slightly yellow-pink bottling, which raises money for books for kids, is one of the better rosés of the vintage, starting with aromas of struck stone, lemon peel and ashy melon. It's very crisp on the palate, with brisk lemon-spray and pink-lime flavors, bound together with immense tension.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: The Great Brain Cell Sacrifice 2019 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made by female winemaking trailblazer Lane Tanner from the Garey and Sierra Madre vineyards in the Santa Maria Valley, this thirst-quenching wine is very light in the glass, offering aromas of cranberry, wild thyme, dark sage and rust. Brisk acidity and spicy white-pepper flavors frame the dried strawberry, salumi and sagebrush elements of the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lumen 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a superfresh expression of this hallowed block of grapes, starting with crisp aromas of black raspberry, pomegranate and light fennel pollen. It zips across the palate with fresh red-fruit flavors that are lifted by bay leaf and sage and wrapped in tangible tension.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Paradise Springs 2018 Founders Block Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Cole Ranch, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: An intriguing, earthy, minerally aroma continues in the flavors of this medium-bodied and attractively taut wine from the tiny American Viticultural Area of Cole Ranch. Snappy red-cherry and cranberry flavors meet a chalky, tangy quality on the palate for a sense of freshness and grip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rootdown 2019 Pinot Noir (Cole Ranch)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This site sits on thin, rocky, volcanic soils, bringing a mineral foundation to the flavors. There's a lightly funky, leathery note as well, along with more elegant fruit flavors of tart raspberry and pie cherry. The acids add touches of orange peel, and the overall impression is a well-balanced, somewhat quirky wine with interesting threads of fruit, rock and leather.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2017 Outcrop Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a superfresh expression of this hallowed block of grapes, starting with crisp aromas of black raspberry, pomegranate and light fennel pollen. It zips across the palate with fresh red-fruit flavors that are lifted by bay leaf and sage and wrapped in tangible tension.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Paradise Springs 2018 Founders Block Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Subtle, complex and glorious aromas and flavors of black fruits, mint and oak spices give this full-bodied wine plenty to savor. Generous cinnamon, nutmeg, clove and toasted oak accents weave through the nose, palate and finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bee Hunter 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Mixing five different Dijon clones (hence the name), this tightly-wound young wine is wrapped in earthy, herbal scents and textures. There's a compact weave of red berries and pomegranate fruits, and further details from biodynamic farming, 30% whole cluster fermentation, native yeasts and aging in one third new French oak. It seems clear that a bit more bottle age will reveal more of the depth and detail currently bound up in this wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brick House 2018 Les Djonnais Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling begins with aromas of bay leaf, wet sage, tart raspberry and a hint of toast. The palate packs in roasted flavors of grilled plums and charred berries with a crushed rock minerality, all wrapped in a tense structure.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lester 2018 Mercurio Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Minty aromas and dense dark-fruit flavors are wrapped in firm tannins and bracing acidity in this full-bodied, ageworthy wine. It offers well concentrated black-cherry and black-plum notes that should open up to more complexity by 2023 and beyond.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bee Hunter 2016 Angel Camp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Alta Langa, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Aromas of red woodland berry, pastry cream and wild herb form the enticing nose. On the elegant palate, bright acidity and a silky perlage accompany pomegranate, orange zest and star anise.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Enrico Serafino 2016 Oudeis Brut Rosé Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This edgy, delicately ripe wine is pushing the envelope on savory character, earthy in black tea, clove and stemmy energy. Tannins are enveloped within the folds of the tangy acidity and the nuanced fruit notes of orange peel and cranberry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donum 2018 Ten Oaks Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Perfumed and effusively inviting on the nose, this light, delicate red is earthy and stemmy, brimming in forest floor, clove and black tea. Plum and pomegranate notes are crisp and tangy.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donum 2018 White Barn Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The ripest and most fruit-forward of the five single vineyard Pinots from Eyrie, this seems almost chunky by comparison with the elegance of the others. That's no criticism, as right out of the bottle it's the most accessible, with a solid core of cherry fruit and balancing acids. A mix of Wadenswil and Pommard clones planted in 1988, the site is directly south-facing, which may account for that extra burst of ripe fruit. Drink now through 2028.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2017 Roland Green Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Raspberry and hibiscus aromas meet with mint, ginger, carnation and wet earth on the nose of this red. The palate combines those earthy tones with dried raspberry, a hint of roast pork and bright rose-petal flavors, finishing on a tart cranberry tone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Joyce 2019 Submarine Canyon Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Muddled mulberry and peppery spices meet with a gamy streak of raw lamb on the intriguing nose of this bottling. Ample fruit and hearty earth flavors show on the sip, which recalls a pork tenderloin topped with plum sauce and crumpled herbs of oregano and thyme.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bargetto 2019 Regan Vineyards Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This mix of Pommard and Wadenswil clones was fermented with wild yeast, 40% whole clusters and aged in 30% new French oak. It's a complex, sophisticated wine, powerfully built with black cherry fruit, whiffs of wood smoke and a streak of Dr. Pepper. The tannins continue the highlighting of dark fruits and barrel toast, finishing with a seam of espresso.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Broadley 2018 Claudia's Choice Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this is an extremely fresh, bright and zesty bottling, beginning with snappy aromas of pomegranate and tarragon. The refreshing palate smashes raspberry, strawberry and cherry together with dewy herbs and buoyant acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Centralas 2019 Syren Spear Vineyards Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean while voluptuous aromas of strawberry, star anise and cinnamon Red Hots candies show on the nose of this bottling, which remains very fresh. Grippy tannins frame cranberry, strawberry, rose-petal and mace flavors on the tight palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Montemar 2016 Zotovich Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This gorgeous, deep and concentrated wine overflows with black-cherry, stewed plum, rosemary and strawberry flavors nicely framed by light tannins and fresh-tasting acidity. It's easy to love its richness, ripeness and good depth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Saintsbury 2018 Donnelly Creek Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Ripe plums and warm baking spices give this full-bodied wine a generous, inviting quality while a broad texture laced with fine-grained tannins is nicely mouthfilling. Clove, cedar and rosemary notes add to its complexity and allure. It was made with 25% whole-cluster fermentation and 40% new French oak.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Donelan 2017 Tripp's Block Perli Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is an aromatic wine with sweet spices and floral scents. Sharp boysenberry fruit cuts across the palate. There are streaks of clean earth and slightly bitter herbs, all well-integrated in terms of balance, but a few more years of bottle age will help to smooth out any rough edges.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bluebird Hill 2018 Zenith Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Oltrepò Pavese, Lombardy, Italy
Description: Elegant, structured and bone-dry, this enticing sparkler offers aromas of Spanish broom, bread dough, white stone fruit and balsamic notes. The focused, savory palate delivers white peach, Meyer lemon and hazelnut set against racy acidity. A silky, persistent mousse lends finesse while a ginger note lingers on the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Cigognola 2013 Moratti Cuvée dell'Angelo Pas Dosé Pinot Nero (Oltrepò Pavese)

Appellation: Alta Langa, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Pinot Nero, this racy sparkler offers enticing aromas of white spring flower, brioche, crushed botanical herb and white stone fruit. The dry, focused palate offers yellow apple, bread crust and citrusy notes alongside an elegant perlage and crisp acidity. It closes on a saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Enrico Serafino 2014 Pas Dosé Zero Riserva Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)

Appellation: Alta Langa, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Pinot Nero, this vibrant, focused sparkler has enticing aromas of red berry, violet and botanical herb. Dry and tangy, the savory palate offers juicy strawberry, pomegranate and baking spice alongside bright acidity. An elegant perlage lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gancia 2015 Cuvée 36 Mesi Rosé Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Subtle aromas of mulberry and wild red cherry meet with smoked pork, peppercorns and mint on the nose of this bottling. It lands softly on the palate, where baked cherry and pomegranate flavors meet with rose petals and more mint.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lafond 2018 SRH Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Van Duzer Corridor, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: As with all of Brianne Day's wines this is detailed and well-balanced, a mix of raspberry and cherry fruit with phenolic herbal flavors and textures. The complementary acidity brings a splash of orange juice, and the finish has the slightest hint of leather. Drink now and over the next five years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Day 2018 Johan Vineyards Pinot Noir (Van Duzer Corridor)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Native yeasts and mixed ferments in wood, concrete and steel are hallmarks here. This tightly woven small-barrel selection opens with rhubarb, cranberry and strawberry leaves, then breathes into pure cherry fruit with accents of chamomile tea. It's a wine you will surely want to decant to give it maximum opportunity to expand.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abbott Claim 2018 Abbott Claim Vineyard Orientate Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This young wine opens with strong herbal scents and flavors. That slight bitterness smooths out with a burst of vanilla. The flavors evolve in the glass into a mix of thistle, lovage, wild berry and sour cherry candy. It's destined for a long life and should be tucked away until 2025.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ayoub 2018 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The label honors Mo Ayoub's late brother, and the wine is done in classic Willamette Valley style. Crisp, precise and fresh, it's replete with red berries, tart cherry and underlying minerality. The acidity lifts the flavors as they sail into a lingering finish with a hint of buttered toast.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ayoub 2018 Memoirs Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is the first time this vineyard designate has been offered. It's from a site right across the road from Brick House that is farmed biodynamically by the Brick House team. It's a sexy wine with sharp scents and flavors of berries, along with focused details of pepper, rosemary and thyme. Half was whole-cluster fermented, and one-third of the cooperage was new.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brick House 2018 Halliday Hill Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Underbrush, eucalyptus, rhubarb and ripe berry form the nose on this 100% Pinot Nero. Elegantly structured and focused, the linear palate features spiced cranberry, pomegranate, star anise and a dollop of vanilla alongside polished tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Pancrazi 2016 Vigna Baragazza Pinot Nero (Toscana)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Elegantly structured, this 100% Pinot Nero is racy and loaded with finesse. It opens with aromas of rhubarb, red berry and baking spice that carry over to the focused palate along with strawberry compote, mineral and licorice. Bright acidity and refined, supple tannins provide energy and the polished framework. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Pancrazi 2018 Monte Ferrato Pinot Nero (Toscana)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a thick, concentrated and robustly ripe red wine, intensely flavored in dark tones of cherry and blackberry. Tannic and oak driven, it dances around complex edges of power and structure, suggesting a desire for more aging. Enjoy this red best from 2028–2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donum 2018 Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Wines from this estate, located in a prime spot atop Ribbon Ridge, neatly capture the essence of the AVA. Fresh cranberry and raspberry fruit are accented with a mineral foundation. There are scents and highlights of seashells, and the flavors penetrate well into the lingering finish, retaining excellent balance throughout.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lichtenwalter 2018 Estate Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Already in what feels like its prime drinking window, this is displaying bountiful herbal phenolic flavors, and moving the black fruits into the background. Shadows of earth, cola and dried herbs continue into a fading finish. Enjoy it at its peak and drink over the next two or three years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Rex Hill 2017 Jacob-Hart Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Densely packed aromas of boysenberry and blackberry are lifter by purple flowers, loamy earth and iron shavings on the nose of this bottling. It lands hearty on the palate, where the berry fruits are dark but still brisk and a lingering licorice spice leads into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2018 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Württemberg, Germany
Description: Violet, fur and spicy notes of plum and black cherry compote collide in this decadently perfumed Pinot Noir. While light in body, it's a penetrating, intensely fruity red held upright by zesty cranberry acidity and very fine, feathery tannins. Ready now but should drink at peak through 2027 and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schnaitmann 2017 Steinwiege Pinot Noir (Württemberg)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This fundraising wine, made by the Lieu Dit team and supporting the Books for Kids Foundation, begins with herbal aromas of incense, moss and smudged green sage as well as dark cherry and plum. The palate is hearty, with roasted cherry and plum flavors alongside tart plum-skin flavors, with a delicate rosewater element that carries into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: The Great Brain Cell Sacrifice 2018 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Van Duzer Corridor, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A bit austere when first opened, this rewards extra breathing time (or decanting) with impressive details from biodynamic farming. Beetroot, dried herbs, spicy floral notes and even stem flavors are in the mix, but with none of the bitterness that too often accompanies wines in which the fruit flavors are subdued. Raspberry punches through, along with pomegranate and a hint of bay leaf. The wine is fermented with wild yeasts and aged 22 months in 15% new oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Day 2017 Johan Vineyards Pinot Noir (Van Duzer Corridor)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite deep and rich in all aspects, this bottling from a hillside block of the Dijon clone 115 shows black cherry, mace, star anise and clove on the suave nose. It's a meaty Pinot Noir on the palate, showing both viscosity and grippy tannins while delivering powerful fruit flavors and a caramelized, vanilla-kissed finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: La Grande Majesté San Bernabe Vineyard Estate Grown
Name: Diora 2018 La Grande Majesté San Bernabe Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark and brooding in richly fruity layers of plum, dark cherry and sweet oak, this is an opulent and succulent wine, textured and complex in tannin structure and weight. Notes of baking spice, black tea and forest provide savory contrast to the ripe fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sangiacomo 2018 Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: A perfumed, juicy wine bold and expressive in black cherry, blood orange and wild strawberry, this offers a thick foundation of profound structure and pronounced oak. Full bodied, it is intensely complex and powerful.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donum 2018 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Louie is the estate reserve bottling, sourced from the Holstein Vineyard. It's a smooth, seductive wine, sourced principally from the oldest vines in the vineyard. Plum jam and vanilla cream flavors combine in a plush palate. There's a mix of mulberry and blueberry fruit also, and a lick of milk chocolate from aging in one-quarter new barrels. This is the sort of irresistible young Pinot that may be at its best already.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Granville 2018 Louie Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Whole-cluster fermentation is the hallmark of this wine, which remains stubbornly closed. Aggressive aeration and hours of time help considerably, bringing up tight layers of dried tea leaves, chamomile, fruit leather and an overriding minerality. This is a wine that clearly shows the hand of the winemaker and the stamp of the soil. Give it more bottle age and decant it prior to drinking.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ayoub 2018 Estate Whole Cluster Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is cedary and spicy in aroma. It is sturdy in texture and nicely packed with black cherry and black olive flavors. There is also a slight grip to the appetizing mouthfeel, making this a delight to drink.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Brashley 2018 Hacienda Sequoia Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy and silky, this memorable wine brims in tones of cardamom, black tea and tangy red fruit. The spice accents continue through a lengthy, complex finish, leaving this with a nuanced, elegant feel.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Square Peg 2017 Riddle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A two-barrel selection, one of which was all Pommard clone, this needs a bit more time to fully integrate itself. There are excellent components of pomegranate fruit, seashell minerality and savory umami and fungus flavors. The mouthfeel is a bit chalky and astringent, but further bottle age should smooth things out.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lichtenwalter 2018 Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy and silky, this memorable wine brims in tones of cardamom, black tea and tangy red fruit. The spice accents continue through a lengthy, complex finish, leaving this with a nuanced, elegant feel.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Square Peg 2017 Riddle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted red-plum and berry aromas meet with hints of hickory smoke, baked soil and dried mint on the nose of this bottling by pioneer winemaker Ken Brown. The palate is quite rich, offering baked raspberry, mace and minty herb flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ken Brown 2016 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Replete with a lush mix of blue and purple fruits, this supple and satisfying wine pops with juicy acidity and ripe blueberries. A thin thread of bitter herbs suggests that some whole clusters might be in the mix, but the overall balance and ripeness is spot-on.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bluebird Hill 2018 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The five single-vineyard selections from Eyrie are partially determined by elevation, Sisters being the lowest site. It's a gentle wine, with flowery highlights and pretty strawberry fruit. But it flexes its muscle and gains power in the mouth, with the floral details of wild yeasts, and suggestions of bread and toast. It's well-balanced and should drink well through the rest of the decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2017 Sisters Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a single clone, single block selection, replete with red fruits. It hints at the lighter side of ripeness, touching upon rhubarb and tart cherry, along with a seam of orange marmalade. It's a tasty and complex effort, with a tongue-drying mineral-herbal finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Dion 2018 115 West Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The Riboli family is providing great value with this newer line of wines, even in the hard-to-master affordably priced Pinot Noir category. Generous aromas of baked red plum, strawberry, nutmeg and star anise lead into a palate that's amply tense with prickly acidity. That balances the rich stewed fruit, caramel and mint flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Highlands 41 2019 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

Appellation: Oltrepò Pavese, Lombardy, Italy
Description: Aromas of brioche, yellow spring flower and white stone fruit shape the nose. Made entirely with Pinot Nero, the bone-dry, vibrant palate offers yellow apple, pomegranate and Meyer lemon alongside a hint of hazelnut. Crisp acidity and an elegant perlage provide balance and finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Moratti Metodo Classico Cuvée More Pas Dosé
Name: Castello di Cigognola NV Moratti Metodo Classico Cuvée More Pas Dosé Pinot Nero (Oltrepò Pavese)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a touch of game on the nose of this affordable and complex bottling, which also shows aromas of smoked berry, clove and garam masala. Roasted strawberry and red plum meet with game, orange rind, herbs and cracked pepper on the well-seasoned palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tassajara 2019 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Appellation: Alta Langa, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Pinot Nero, this has delicate aromas of rose, rhubarb, red berry and wet stone. Reflecting the nose, the dry, linear palate features pomegranate, smoky graphite and a hint of bread crust framed in racy acidity and a lively perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tosti 2016 Rachele Rosé Brut Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This eight-barrel selection handles the challenges of a lighter vintage well, delivering a balanced palate with red currants, raspberries and sweet spice. All components are well-integrated, and the lingering finish suggests aging potential through the rest of the decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2017 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is the reserve label for Abbey Road Farm. It's a two-barrel selection from the same sources as the regular Pinot Noir; one barrel was new. Supple dark fruits, along with a slightly bitter streak of barrel toast, give the cherry flavors a sort of charred character. The wine is in good shape for near-term drinking, with medium length and balance. Decanting first is recommended to soften the barrel impact.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Wilkens Family 2018 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A second all-Pommard clone offering from the winery, this showcases a different vineyard block. It's an aromatic wine, redolent with roses and raspberries. It's tangy and tasty in the mouth, with fresh raspberry fruit buoyed with well-balanced acidity. The underlying minerality expands and extends the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2018 Block 10 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Eyrie now makes five single-vineyard Pinots, along with this estate blend. There's a pretty potent whiff of leather, and the palate carries a funky note that will please some palates more than others. Other highlights of sassafras come around a core of classic Dundee Hills cherry fruit, but the palate seems a bit muted by the tack room notes. Drink this over the next couple of years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2017 Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From an older vineyard planted in the mid-1970s and since renamed, this is an elegant wine with fresh raspberry and Satsuma orange flavors. All neutral oak was used, though a light suggestion of cocoa remains, to good effect. Enjoyable now, while it's young and juicy, this should continue to develop and even improve over the next six to eight years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Trathen Hall 2017 Ana Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh hibiscus and boysenberry-pie aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Crisp and tart berry flavors pop on the sip, where rose-petal elements add complexity and the acidity keeps the entire package very fresh.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Colluvial 2018 Las Nenas Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tart and tangy aromas of red plum, hibiscus and dewy herbs show on the nose of this bottling, which comes from the vineyard that's on the same property as this winery. Blistered plum and red-currant flavors meet with star anise and warm clove spices on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: D'Alfonso-Curran 2018 Rancho La Vina Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This estate-grown wine is packed with Pinot power. Scents and flavors open with strawberry leaves and Bing cherry fruit, backed by grippy tannins. The herbal side of the grape is much in evidence, but balanced throughout. It spend just under a year in 18% new French oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Dion 2018 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This cuvée is mostly a blend of fruit from the Jacob-Hart and Alloro vineyards. Tasted at three years of age it has smoothed out, so what may have been somewhat bitter herbal highlights are softened and matched to fig and briary berry fruit. Barrel aging 11 months in one-third new French oak adds a finishing streak of espresso.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Rex Hill 2017 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy black fruit and a hint of black licorice dot the thick, opulent palate of this hearty wine from a warm vintage. Dried herb, clove and toasted oak finish in a swirl of vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chateau St. Jean 2017 Gap's Crown Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Supple, vivid raspberry fruit is on full display and is juicy and bright. The wine was aged 18 months in French oak, though little or no toast flavors are evident. Rather there are well-handled details of skin and stem, and fine balance throughout.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cherry Hill 2018 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is the first estate bottling from this acclaimed (pun intended) vineyard since new owner Antony Beck and his team took over. The vineyard is being managed organically with some biodynamic practices. Wild yeasts are used for fermentation, which brings some unusual floral and textural components. The wine is lightly ripened, with cranberry, raspberry and mineral highlights. It was aged for about a year in one-third new oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abbott Claim 2018 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The name honors the owners' three cats, also referenced by the bow-tie logo and notched label. This reserve is a deeper, more robust companion to the winery's regular 2018, with ripe raspberry and cherry fruit that have a bit of a candy character. Aging in 40% new French oak brings touches of toast and cracker.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Benza 2018 Three Tuxedos Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from grapes grown at the Cartograph estate as well as Starscape Vineyard, this wine is thick and generous on the palate. Tea, clove and oak accent a core of crisp cherry and raspberry before finishing on a rich vanilla note.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cartograph 2018 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Jubilant aromas of ripe melon, strawberry and cotton candy make for a very appealing entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate is generous as well, showing rose-petal, jasmine and more pink-melon flavors, balanced by plenty of acidity and a relatively taut texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lieu Dit 2019 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Juicy aromas of raspberry sorbet, plum, mace and tarragon are fresh and zesty on the nose of this bottling. The palate is full of pleasant herbal tones, from fennel pollen to licorice, and also offers black raspberry and potpourri flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Complicated 2019 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This generous, mouthfilling wine offers abundant black-cherry, strawberry and mint flavors while fresh acidity and light tannins add a nice grip to the texture. It's quite flavorful, well balanced and enjoyable.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Pennyroyal Farm 2018 Jean Sheep Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: McMinnville, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Half of the ferment was whole clusters, and the wine has astringent phenolic flavors showing, with details of mint, tarragon, sage and dried Mediterranean herbs. The fruit tilts toward cranberry, with plenty of backing acidity. The wine was aged entirely in neutral oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Trathen Hall 2017 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This vineyard was planted by Mo Ayoub in 2013, with nine Pinot Noir clones mixed across five acres. It's a juicy wine, with zesty flavors of citrus and raspberries. The minerality common to many Ayoub Pinots is evident here as well, and with an astringent herbaceousness (20% of the ferment was whole clusters). The mouthfeel is lively and the aging potential apparent. Drink 2022–2030.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ayoub 2018 Anonimo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A full body and a brawny texture give this impressive and concentrated wine a big impact on the palate, where deep black-cherry, mint and cranberry flavors vie for attention. Moderate tannins and good acidity add to its impression of strength and power.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bee Hunter 2017 Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

Appellation: Piemonte, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Dry, racy and elegant, this has subtle, enticing scents of spring wild flower, wild herb and stone fruit. The focused, linear palate features apple, Meyer lemon, saline and hazelnut alongside crisp acidity. A lively, refined perlage lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Neive 2014 Metodo Classico Extra Brut Pinot Nero (Piemonte)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy black fruit leads the way to a wealth of black-tea, oak and forest notes in this well-made, elegantly styled wine. Good acidity keeps it fresh and lengthy, the tannins supple and well behaved, providing structure and balance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Castello di Amorosa 2018 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark in the glass, this bottling offers a very earthy, genuinely Burgundian nose of mud, clay, mushroom and mulberry, with a light mint element providing lift. The palate is quite textural and deep, showing more mulberry as well as roasted figs alongside light pepper spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McIntyre Vineyards 2015 Block 3 McIntyre Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hearty aromas of roasted black plum and boysenberry meet with game, star anise and nutmeg on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines flavors of baked berry with vanilla and clove dust.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Montemar 2016 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Oltrepò Pavese, Lombardy, Italy
Description: Focused and vibrant, this wine offers aromas of bread crust, botanical herb and white stone fruit. Made entirely with Pinot Nero, the linear, racy palate delivers tart cherry, lemon zest and hazelnut alongside crisp acidity and a lively perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Oltrenero 2015 Brut Nature Pinot Nero (Oltrepò Pavese)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Abundant toasted oak aromas and flavors dominate this full-bodied, bold and spicy wine. Wood smoke, black pepper and black cherry blend on the palate as moderate tannins give the texture a bit of a bite.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Phillips Hill 2018 L'Air de Mer Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
