Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: A well-made, larger production offering, this wine is richly layered in strawberry, raspberry and black tea, the oak slightly sweet and toasty. Smoky overtones provide a hint of game and earth, leading to a cohesive, resolved finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Etude 2018 Grace Benoist Ranch Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Boysenberry, mulberry, mace, star anise and sandalwood make for a spicy, fruity nose on this bottling. There is a woody flavor of cedar on the palate, where dark-raspberry, wild-mint and pine-needle elements converge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Montemar 2016 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine pushes the envelope in thick, tannic intensity, savory and earthy in forest floor and black tea. The fruit is elusive, a hint of orange peel and cranberry coming to the fore on the midpalate, boosted by lasting acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ram's Gate 2018 Cellar Note Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Pfalz, Germany
Description: Burnt caramel, violet candy and freshly dug beets scent this boldly perfumed Pinot Noir. It's an easy-drinking, crisply concentrated red marked by pert red cherry and plum flavors edged by delicate char and smoke. Solidly made and priced quite reasonably, it's a super find that's best enjoyed now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2018 Pinot Noir (Pfalz)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a light-bodied, earthy and textured estate wine, brightly layered in pomegranate and strawberry flavors. Varietal seasonings of clove and black tea give it complexity and a lengthy, savory finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Schug 2018 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Forward and fruity, this brings raspberries and blackberries, supporting acidity and balanced tannins. Overall it's fairly light but complete and satisfying, with an underlying minerality. Some 40% of the ferment was whole clusters.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Trathen Hall 2017 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Somewhat extracted aromas of dark berries and cola meet with brighter edges of rosewater extract on the nose of this bottling. There's a depth and power to the palate, where tangy black-raspberry and black-plum flavors meet with sagebrush and wild thyme.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Colluvial 2017 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An earthy, very dry take on the grape, this bottle offers aromas of dried strawberry, desiccated beef and rose-petal potpourri on the nose. The palate combines smoked red currant and plum with tar and black-pepper flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2018 Two Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is the winery's most affordable Pinot Noir, and it's a blend of barrels from all the various estate-grown clones and vineyard blocks. It opens a bit rugged and tannic, with dominant flavors of chewy herbs and grape skins. Decanting helps, revealing tart mixed berries, and fine-tuning the overall balance.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brick House 2018 Select Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This five-clone blend sports juicy raspberry fruit, with delicate hints of coconut and vanilla from aging 10 months in 15% new French oak. Just the second vintage from this new estate, it's a light, clean and quite lively wine that should show nicely over the next half decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Benza 2018 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky oak wraps around baked cherry and baking spice in this robustly concentrated and full-bodied wine, warm-climate in nature and style. The jammy rich fruit is layered and lengthy.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Buena Vista 2018 Chateau Buena Vista Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Jammy with earthy, savory elements throughout, this velvety, lush wine is made in a generously, brawny style. Dark red fruit mingles with black tea, clove and toasted oak, full-bodied and ripe on the lengthy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Etude 2017 Heirloom Grace Benoist Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This aromatically inviting wine is sourced from the RainSong and Carlton Hills Vineyards. Scents of plum, fig and cassis seem to promise a rather hefty wine, but it lightens up in the mouth with a complex of fruit and spice flavors that call to mind Fig Newton cookies. In fact, it's at a good point for near-term drinking right now, and should be enjoyed over the next three or four years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abbey Road Farm 2018 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Scorched boysenberry, cola, violet, aged meats and baking-spice aromas mesh together on the heady nose of this bottling. There's a touch of sour plum on the palate, where star anise and roasted meat flavors lead into a long, smoky finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Estancia 2016 Stonewall Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Oltrepò Pavese, Lombardy, Italy
Description: Aromas of bread crust, eucalyptus and fennel carry over to the linear palate along with hazelnut, orange rind and white cherry. An elegant perlage and bright acidity provide the setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Jako Wine 2016 Brut Pinot Nero (Oltrepò Pavese)

Appellation: Oltrepò Pavese, Lombardy, Italy
Description: Made with Pinot Nero, this savory sparkler has enticing aromas of red berry, rose and rhubarb. On the bright, focused palate, crisp acidity and small, persistent bubbles provide an energized, polished setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Oltrenero NV Rosé Cruasé Pinot Nero (Oltrepò Pavese)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: For this wine, free run juice is quickly pressed, leaving a Pinot Noir with no hint of color. The flavors are rich in peach and citrus, with a strong component of skin tannins. The texture and length point to a wine with considerable richness.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2019 White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Estate-grown Dundee Hills Pinots are rare at this price. This palate-pleaser brings red berries, light fresh herbs and a hint of minerals into the mix. Partial whole cluster fermentation adds texture and length.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2018 Watershed Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Scorched boysenberry, cola, violet, aged meats and baking-spice aromas mesh together on the heady nose of this bottling. There's a touch of sour plum on the palate, where star anise and roasted meat flavors lead into a long, smoky finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Estancia 2016 Stonewall Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly reductive hints of tar, dried plum, and crumpled hibiscus meet with hints of charcuterie on the nose of this bottling. Tar and wood qualities kick off the palate, where dark strawberry and mulberry flavors meet with oregano and rose petal.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Estancia 2018 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from vineyards throughout the state, this full-bodied, fruity wine shows plenty of mixed berry goodness. A touch of chocolate adorns the finish, with seems to hit the brakes and briefly hold there before disappearing. Drink through 2022.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: A to Z 2017 The Essence of Oregon Pinot Noir (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This melds together fruit from multiple Willamette Valley AVAs into a clean, aromatic and gulpable style. Even at this young age the briary, peppery berry fruit is quite appealing, and the wine has already settled into a comfortable groove. It's got a bit of stuffing also, and should be enjoyed over the next half decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Four Graces 2019 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Alta Langa, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Subtle aromas of flint, brioche and white stone fruit form the delicate nose. The aromas carry over to the dry palate along with notes of hazelnut and espresso set against a persistent perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Giulio I Brut Extra Brut Riserva
Name: Tosti 2012 Giulio I Brut Extra Brut Riserva Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)

Appellation: Alta Langa, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Aromas of bread crust, toasted walnut and orange rind carry over to the linear palate along with yellow- apple skin. Racy acidity and a lively perlage provide backup.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tosti 2016 Giulio I Brut Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)

Appellation: Alta Langa, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Subtle aromas of flint, brioche and white stone fruit form the delicate nose. The aromas carry over to the dry palate along with notes of hazelnut and espresso set against a persistent perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Giulio I Brut Extra Brut Riserva
Name: Tosti 2012 Giulio I Brut Extra Brut Riserva Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)

Appellation: Alta Langa, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Aromas of bread crust, toasted walnut and orange rind carry over to the linear palate along with yellow- apple skin. Racy acidity and a lively perlage provide backup.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tosti 2016 Giulio I Brut Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Meaty and savory flavors are well matched with a firm texture and backed by good underlying cherry notes in this full-bodied and moderately tannic wine. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Theopolis 2019 Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This tightens its flavor focus, being both a select block and a single clone. The strawberry fruit has an earthy note, with a light hint of compost. The flavors expand broadly across the palate before heading down and through. The finish turns bitter, with suggestions of hard rubber and coffee grounds.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2018 Block 9 Pommard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A fine value, this affordable Willamette Valley Pinot is worth hunting for (break out that duck whistle!). Pretty cherry fruit takes hold quickly, with mild acidity and light tannins. It's fruit-driven and pleasantly light, perfect for early drinking with roast fowl.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Duck Pond 2019 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from estate vineyards, this wraps pretty cherry fruit in darker notes of smoke and espresso. Its 18 months in 20% new French oak is showing strongly now, along with just a hint of reduction expressed as a tinge of burnt rubber. Give it a good airing out, or another couple of years of bottle age.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Territorial 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lightly colored in the glass, this bottling begins with clean lines of black raspberry and boysenberry, with hints of tarragon and nutmeg. The palate is broad with flavors of baked red berry, juniper and tarragon, wrapped in resinous tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Summerland 2018 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

Appellation: Oltrepò Pavese, Lombardy, Italy
Description: Made with Pinot Nero, this has aromas of orange zest, walnut, white stone fruit and brioche. The aromas carry on to the bright palate along with candied lemon drop set against a silky perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Cigognola NV Moratti Brut Pinot Nero (Oltrepò Pavese)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black cherry, purple-flower and smoke aromas make for a clean and rich nose on this single-vineyard expression. The palate offers dark-berry jam, tarragon and menthol flavors, with a light veil of smoke.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Montemar 2016 Rancho La Vina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Oltrepò Pavese, Lombardy, Italy
Description: Aromas of orange liqueur, toasted walnut and bread crust form the nose. The aromas carry over to the palate along with honey, mature yellow-apple skin and a candied note set against a foaming perlage. Fresh acidity lifts the rich, evolved flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Jako Wine 2009 Metodo Classico Brut Riserva Pinot Nero (Oltrepò Pavese)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a block selection, with light fruit flavors of mixed red berries. The overall structure is balanced but lacks depth and complexity, with modest acidity and little impact from barrel aging. Drink up.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Duck Pond 2017 Front Yard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Alto Valle del Río Negro, Other, Argentina
Description: Delicately light berry and plum aromas are in the lead, while this Patagonian Pinot is lean and agile in body, with moderate acidity. Cherry, red plum, tomato and spice flavors finish with clarity. Overall, this is fresh and more than competent.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Verum 2019 Pinot Noir (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

Appellation: Alto Valle del Río Negro, Other, Argentina
Description: Delicately light berry and plum aromas are in the lead, while this Patagonian Pinot is lean and agile in body, with moderate acidity. Cherry, red plum, tomato and spice flavors finish with clarity. Overall, this is fresh and more than competent.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Verum 2019 Pinot Noir (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a block selection, with light fruit flavors of mixed red berries. The overall structure is balanced but lacks depth and complexity, with modest acidity and little impact from barrel aging. Drink up.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Duck Pond 2017 Front Yard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This middle-of-the-road style brings light and fresh fruit flavors of strawberry, raspberry and cherry fruit, with highlights of sassafras. A finishing lick of coffee wraps it up.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Great Oregon Wine Company 2018 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This smooth, almost sweet-tasting and medium-bodied wine from the owners of Ferrington Vineyard offers mild cherry and raspberry flavors accented by ample vanilla and cinnamon touches on a polished texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fathers Daughters 2017 Ellas's Reserve Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of blackberry syrup, black cherry, clove and cola are quite rich on the nose of this bottling. Wild-sage flavors kick off the sip, where a very sharp acidity cuts into ripe boysenberry jam.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Montemar 2016 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The raspberry fruit is fresh but falls on the thin side, without the sort of depth and complexity that a reserve designation implies. All in all it's a balanced, fruity, simple wine that should be enjoyed within the next year.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Duck Pond 2017 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a robust, hearty and meaty red wine, brimming in tangy red fruit. Elements of baking spice, vanilla and earth accent a foundation of toasty oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kokomo 2018 Winemaker's Reserve Peters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: One of the most widely available Oregon Pinots, the Acrobat maintains its easy-drinking style while capturing the basic varietal character of the grape. Fruity berry flavors, moderate alcohol, balanced acidity and tamed tannins all bring this forward, pleasant wine into focus. Drink over the next half decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Acrobat 2018 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Scorched beef, singed sage, iron shavings and cranberry aromas make for a unique nose on this bottling. There's a rugged quality to the sip, where sun-dried earth and charred meat flavors sit atop the light strawberry and cranberry fruit.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Porter & Plot 2018 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rosewater-extract, balsamic-cranberry-sauce and potpourri aromas show on the tangy, slightly funky nose of this bottling. There's a strongly tart tang on the palate of red-plum skins and pickled herbs.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hamdog 2018 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Bold and fruity, this medium-bodied wine adds buttery overtones to almost jammy black-cherry and strawberry flavors. It feels soft and broad on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mon Frere 2019 Vintner's Selection Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a thick, toasty and oak-driven red wine, with waxy red fruit at its heart. Medium bodied and concentrated in flavor, it has a straightforward and ripe finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chateau St. Jean 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly tarry aromas of cranberry, charred beef and dusty, baked earth show on the nose of this bottling. Blistered cranberry flavors meet with slightly bitter earth tones on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Folly of the Beast 2019 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rather extracted aromas of black plum paste, clove and mace show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very ripe with black-plum-pudding, nutmeg and dominant clove flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Montemar 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: There's not much depth here, just light cherry and cola flavors. A whiff of vanilla and hints of mocha add some detail, and the wine does a quick fade, finishing with slightly bitter tannins.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Great Oregon Wine Company 2018 Coles Valley Vineyard Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Patagonia, Other, Argentina
Description: Plummy red berry aromas include notes of oak grain, paint and vanilla. A medium to full palate is undemanding, while plum and raspberry flavors are short and slightly chemical before disappearing quickly on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Chacra 2019 Barda Pinot Noir (Patagonia)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried strawberries, leather and hibiscus aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There's a slightly sweet ripe quality to the red fruit of the sip, yet the smoke and dried herb elements keep it serious.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: KIng Chancho 2018 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine seems to be at or slightly past its prime. Cherry cola fruit has a faded feeling, and the accents of leather and funk emphasize the sense that it should be consumed now. It finishes with a dash of lemon oil.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ransom 2015 Selection Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Patagonia, Other, Argentina
Description: A pinched and gritty nose is shy on fruit aromas and requires airing to freshen up. A tight palate is limited in scope and breadth, while this tastes of plum, currant and tomato. On the finish, this leaves a mild burning sensation.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Aranwa 2019 Pinot Noir (Patagonia)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a simple, hearty and robustly ripe wine from the famous site that traffics in jammy black cherry and strawberry. Herbal components and clove notes give it an earthiness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cherry Pie 2016 Stanly Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dusty red plum and currant aromas are easy to peg as Pinot Noir. A grainy-feeling palate with chewy tannins deals flavors of spiced cherry and raspberry, while this displays mild burn and a vague note of buttery oak on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Salentein 2019 Portillo Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Uco Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine shows a flinty, charred aroma followed by robust cherry and grilled plum flavors wrapped in moderate tannins. It's a hearty weekday beverage.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sierra Del Mar 2018 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is certified pesticide free, which is not the same as organic. It's a modest, astringent wine with light flavors of black cherry and cola. A slightly earthy streak runs through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: LifeVine 2019 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
